ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest, we sincerely thank you for choosing Uppuveli Beach By DSK and for your feedback. We are quite surprised and disheartened to read your comments, which we find to be inappropriate and exaggerated. As a relatively new establishment operating at nearly 90% occupancy during your stay, we acknowledge encountering some operational and service challenges. However, we believe these issues were not as severe as described in your comment. Our team is earnestly committed to enhancing our standards and ensuring memorable experiences for all guests. This commitment is evident from the numerous positive comments and feedback we have received on review platforms.
We understand from your remarks that you were seeking a budget-friendly option and had reserved the remainder of your stay accordingly. Unfortunately, we were unable to meet your expectations regarding price.
We thank you once again for your patronage and look forward to welcoming you back where we can create more positive impression.
placeInfo/address: 84, Nilaveli Road 3rd Mile Post, Trincomalee, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
text:
No way a 5 star resort. Cheap looking big resort . Beachbar with way to loud music. Waiters playing pool in stead of serving people. Expensive food with poor taste. 
Breakfast at most 3* worth. 
Outside the room left overs from former guests . 
Smell of dead animal around pool area.
People who rate this 5* have never experienced 5*.
title: People who rate this 5* have never experienced 5*

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Alain Versace,

Thank you for your feedback. We sincerely apologize for the inconveniences you experienced during your stay. As the resort had just opened, we were hosting a grand opening event to express our gratitude's to the well-wishers who contributed in many ways to make this project sucessfull irrespective of many hurdles like COVID and economic crisis of Sri Lanka . We totally understand your concern and this kind of events will not be repeated again.

To compensate for the inconvenience, we provided a considerable discount on your room charge and we hope you have considered this as our genuine gesture. We deeply regret that this event affected your stay, and we are committed to improving our services to ensure a more enjoyable experience for all our guests in the future.

We appreciate your understanding and hope to have the chance to welcome you back for a more peaceful stay.

Warm regards,

Team - Uppuveli Beach By DSK
placeInfo/address: 84, Nilaveli Road 3rd Mile Post, Trincomalee, Trincomalee 31000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Before booking be sure that no party from owner is going on
text:
After more than 2 weeks around Sri Lanka we decided to spend 3 nights in this luxury resort on the seaside to have some rest before going back to Colombo direction and home.
The resort opened just last month and was not yet 100% ready but it was enough to offer most of the services. 
The location is fantastic, room brand new, great pool and right on the beach. High price but consistent with the service offered.

Unfortunately we found out that during our whole stay, the owner was organising a non stop party with relative and friends (representing more than 80% of hotel capacity) for some celebration. This was drawing completely the attention of the whole staff, dinner was not available for us because staff was preparing food for the group (we were suggested to go eat outside), laundry service not available (but for party group yes) and no sleeping until midnight every night because of loud music again for entertaining owner friends and relatives.
After I complained I got some symbolic discount and lots of “sorry” from hotel management but me and my family (2 adults and 2 kids) were feeling for 3 days like being in a private party in the home of someone else in which we were not invited.

This behaviour is totally unacceptable and unprofessional for a so called 5 star luxury resort in which I paid full price and where it was much more important to entertain the owner and his friends than to offer a relaxing stay to its customers.
title: Beautiful brand new resort but totally unprofessional behaviour from owner

placeInfo/address: No 17 Bloomfield Rd, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: The location is not worth its price. It’s a nice place but hugely overpriced. E.g. bed linen were used. They changed it immediately upon request but it was indeed very uncomfortable. Breakfast was rather poor. Service needs definitely to be improved.
title: Overpriced

text:
Was the first to arrive at the buffet and saw that the bowls for soup hadn’t even been washed. Spoke to the manager at Ports of Call, that arrogantly disregarded pretty much everything we mentioned, including that it was that way when we arrived which before anybody had served soup.
Very disappointed to see a so-called five star hotel not even bother to clean their dishes.
Regarding the spread of food - flavorless, bland and without much to imagine.
Had only three types of fruits.
Cannot put into words how disappointing this experience was. How we call this a five star hotel is beyond my wildest understanding.
Side note - the doors in the bathrooms were hanging on to their hinges, the dustbin was overflowing and the food, terrible. 

Brace yourself to see the photo of a dish at a five star hotel. 

The fact that I had to still pay…
title: Absolutely, definitely, never ever again

roomTip: Over crowded buffet , super crowded lobby. Clueless staff and least interest front office persons!
text: I have stayed in a lot of Taj properties in India. I have always had a pleasant and luxurious experience in all these times- Hyderabad, mangalore, chennai, Mumbai, Kerala, Bangalore . Firslty there was a confusion for the booking made, we booked through make my trip and was told our booking was for feb instead of march. Whereas our booking was for 22nd March 2025. We waited for 30mins for actually getting a room assigned. We were upgraded by the front desk person but I was shocked to see the room. I have stayed in a lot of Taj properties, but have not seen such badly maintained rooms. My room was dusty and had a used cigarette packed behind the main door. I was shocked to see the room was not cleaned properly before it was assigned to me.  The entire property is pretty but so badly maintained, The desk near lift is also dusty and had beer cans on them. I failed to understand how the room assigned was a upgrade, it was so dusty, the floor had particles and was so unclean. After traveling from Galle and having a full hectic day I had zero energy left in me to call and request for a room change after already waiting for 30 mins. I gave up and stayed in my room assigned. The dinner was nice and pleasant and service was good. But the breakfast was horrible. it was the worst breakfast buffer ever. the layout at the restaurant is so bad. there is hardly any space between the food served and island with food kept. Even the tables were so close to each other. I think the breakfast was over crowded and was so chaotic. It took us so much time to get our food from live counter. The tables were also messy and unclean. The bakery option for breakfast was so bad, it looked so old like the item was bad days before. Overall horrible experience.I stayed at ITC ratnadipa Colombo for 2 days before going to galle. I think that is the most pleasant experience i had and Taj Samudra was an absolute disappointment. I have not got the Tata Neu points also for the stay at Taj Samudra
title: Horrible and unpleasant!

placeInfo/address: 25 Galle Face Center Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Stay across the street at the Galle Face Hotel. It's historic and quirky and authentic.
text:
This hotel feels like the worst of India, and not even close to the best of Sri Lanka. Do yourself a favour and stay anywhere else in Colombo, especially if you are a woman traveling alone. 

At Taj Samudra, there are a multitude of men in suits whose apparent job it is to make solo women travellers feel intimidated in this hotel. After ordering a poolside G&T, I was accused by 3 different men (in suits) of not being a registered guest at the hotel, despite showing them my registration confirmation. They arrived one at a time while I was sitting by the pool in my bathing suit, and the last man was beyond angry, argumentative, and rude. When I'd finally had enough and went inside to complain, they were all arguing around a computer and not ONE of them offered an apology. 

After my experience at the pool, I had a lovely dinner across the street at the Galle Face Hotel. I went to bed early, only to have two separate men knock on my door. I did not open the door, I just shouted that I was in BED! This made me rather nervous on top of everything else. 

I chose this property for its location by the sea and the pretty pool area, but I spent most of my time (and money) across the street at the Galle Face Hotel where I was treated kindly and with respect. (Stay there and not the Taj Samudra!) The Galle Face Hotel is genuine and historic. You might pay a little more, but it's worth it for the charm. 

To be fair, one gentleman in management at Taj Samudra did his best to try and right things. Chaminda Dehiwatte went out of his way to try and get me to chat with the Manager about my treatment, but I'd already had enough. He approached me when I was checking out to switch to a different hotel, and he tried his best to smooth things over, but again, it was too late. Mr. Dehiwatte offered me a free buffet lunch, which I declined – instead, I suggested he take one of my room nights off my bill. He did, which was nice but it still was a really crappy experience.

The pool was indeed lovely, but on the first day they were setting up for a wedding and it felt like being on a construction site.    

Are here good things about the hotel? My room overlooking the sea was nice and clean. The housekeeping staff did a good job, and were friendly. If you want a large Indian wedding, this could be a great place. If you want a peaceful home base in Colombo, stay absolutely anywhere else.
title: Single female travelers, avoid at all costs. This hotel is India, not Sri Lanka.

text:
The hotel didn’t meet the expectations of a Taj property. While the location is excellent, the property feels run-down and understaffed.

Our check-in experience on a Sunday afternoon was disappointing, with an unwelcoming receptionist who offered no information about breakfast. However, the support staff was warm and reflected the signature Taj hospitality.

We stayed in a sea-view room with a stunning view, but the balcony was dirty, and the bathroom fixtures were in poor condition.

The breakfast buffet is vast, with excellent Sri Lankan hoppers and breakfast rolls, but the Indian options were disappointing—some dishes were undercooked or overdone. A smaller menu with better quality would be preferable.

The hotel seemed severely understaffed, leading to long delays in room service.

Overall, the stay didn’t feel worth the cost.
title: Didn't feel like a Taj property

placeInfo/address: 25 Galle Face Center Road, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
My feedback might sound a bit harsh and a partial reason for the same could be that we checked into Taj Samudra after staying at Taj Bentota for three days and we were swept away by the hospitality and warmth we received there!

I'll start with the check-in experience. It was kind of okay, it was quick but lacked that warmth which is always appreciated. It felt like everything including the ambience was very busy. People were just running around here and there. There was someone offering welcome drinks and hot towels the next day but we were not offered anything when we checked in. Similarly, we had to wait in the lobby for someone to guide us through the hotel to our room and this whole sequence gave us the feeling like we are not welcomed there. Just want to emphasize that no one was rude, it's just that the hospitality (which we thoroughly enjoyed at Taj Bentota) was missing. Everything felt very transactional, like a commercial-only engagement. 

Dining Experience: 
The food tasted AWESOME!
Was everything great there? No! We went to Navratan (the Indian speciality restaurant) for dinner and was kind of taken aback by the appearance of the restaurant. It was themed like an Indian restaurant but the aesthetics could have been better. For example, there was even no false ceiling at the venue, it looked very dim-lit, downtrodden kind of a place. On top of that, the hospitality here was again missing. The serving staff again sounded very transactional which was in complete contrast with our experience at Taj Bentota. There the staff was not just welcoming but very cheerful too, the serving staff, the chefs everyone greeted us with a smile. That smile was totally absent over here. Even though the food tasted to notch, the presentation was way below the expectation. For example, we ordered Dahi Kebab for starters, for pieces arrived with just the salad, the server served us the kebabs and took the salad away. We even had to ask for mint chutney which should have accompanied the starter. Afterall, mint chutney is the holy grail of all the starters.

Our 1 and a half year daughter was also with us at the dinner. Now, I've been to many Taj properties earlier and it had been my experience consistently that if you are staying at the property, in that case the accompanying child eats for free. My experience at all other properties was even elevated because the Chef himself used to come to us to take the order for the baby so that he can prepare the food just like how the baby's mother intends it to be. Be it Taj Exotica Goa, Cidade De Goa, Taj Lakefront Bhopal or our last destination Taj Bentota, this experience was constant. It made us believe that this is a global Taj policy and hence we ordered for the baby just like we are used to of ordering. We were shocked when the check was presented to us as it included the pricing for the full portion (not even half) for the baby too. When I asked the manager about the same, their answer was plain and straightforward that we charge for everything. Now it's not like that I cannot pay out in not willing to pay that amount, my concern is related to the experience which is not the same as other Taj Hotels. Whenever I recommend hotels to my friends (who all are young parents btw), I always highlight them this fact as an USP that Taj chefs prepare for for babies as per your will and they don't even charge for it. Infact I stayed in Ginger hotel once, and even they did not charge for the food my baby had at their restaurant. They didn't even charge for a soft dosa which I ordered through IRD for my daughter. Not just Ginger, at all other properties, even IRD, milk etc was never changed for the baby. I needed some clarity about the policy, if there's one, so I went to chat with the front desk, unfortunately, they were again clueless about the same. They later called the Director F&B (Mr Abhishek Chatterjee, if I remember the name correctly), who was the only charming person (apart from the guy at concierge desk) at this property. He also didn't knew if any such policy exists or not but he took the responsibility that he'll find out and took that time also made sure that the items ordered for the baby are not charged. To be fair, our dining bill was also revised. However, the clarification is still pending about the exact policy. It should be clarified as we don't want to communicate incorrect information as recommendation.

I also booked a Taj Club room going by the description that it allows access to the Taj Club. I thought I'll get a taste of some added benefits by availing this room as there were other cheaper options available. The first time I went to Taj Club, no one was at reception, when I went inside and called 'hello' two folks appeared, out of them one was really a character as he was trying to be way too smart. When I said no one was at reception, he quickly said that desk is not operational. If that's the case, it should be mentioned on the desk itself. From there, a vicious sequence of being over smart in every answer started. I was told that babies are not allowed in the Taj Club. If that's the case, then you should not take booking with a child guest for the Taj Club Room. If you are taking the booking then you should extend the services. Anyways, nothing except coffee and stake cookies were available and he guy offered to send it to our room so we agreed to it. Now, next day, when I thought I'll not be a pain to the guys so went in there and asked them to send the coffee to the room, this time, I was again told a rule (by a new executive) that they cannot send the things to the room. In summary, in just two days I was told that I cannot be at Taj Club with a baby but can avail the services at the room on the first day and the next day was told that I cannot be at Taj Club nor I can avail the services in my room as well. Unfortunately, not much literature is available on your website about Taj Club from where I could have confirmed the exact rules. In short, I've only wasted my money by booking a Taj Club room it seems, I could have picked any cheaper option and it would have been just the same! 

Not everything was bad! The lady at the IRD was very polite. The food was so amazing that even after having such a bad experience on the first day, we again sent for Paneer Lababdaar and Cheese Garlic Naan ( this time through IRD) and the food was again smashing! I've not had such rich Cheese Garlic Naan anywhere. 

Points to improve: 
Hospitality/Smiles
Policies should be inline with other Tajs
Rules and regulations about Child food and Taj Club should be clarified

Thank you! 

Regards, 
Ravi Sharma
title: A huge room for improvement!

text: Worst Taj experience ever, it was not expected from a Taj property. Being a brand which is synonymous to luxury and hospitality, it was a disappointment. The entire property was screaming for maintenance. The carpet flooring outside room was so dirty and looked not been cleaned properly from ages. Room Doorbell which is not an expensive item had no dnd or cleaning sticker, which is very basic of a hotel these days. The room had really bad flooring, dirty corners, with paint patching all over the switches. The wooden furniture was not been maintained at all, and the glass table had all the paint patches also. Along with that wiring was messy and instead of cleaning the switch board they have painted it white. The Ac vent was broken and filthy, seems like not been cleaned since the hotel opened up. Bathroom was even worst, dirty corners broken showers, paint stains all over the glass counter. With all this negative part one n only thing i would appreciate is the smile on the face of the staff. The staff is really good, truly welcoming.
title: Not Expected from Taj Property

text:
A very disappointing experience.  We were booked into the Thaala hotel a few miles down the coast, but an air conditioning failure there caused us to be bumped to the Eden. To compensate, we were promised an upgrade room.
Arriving at the Eden, it was complete chaos - looked like an airport departure lounge with people and suitcases everywhere. Eventually we were shown to our room, which was completely and totally basic.  I queried it being a standard room, which they agreed it was, so I explained we had been offered an upgrade. Suddenly they claimed the room was an upgraded one - allegedly because of the sea view.  Looking at the hotel, it would appear all the rooms had sea views, so don't really understand the logic here.
Since it belongs to a large chain, I knew we weren't going to get any sense, and we were only staying one night, so we accepted the room.  Our tour guide contacted the manager, who said he would come and talk to us. Needless to say, he didn't........
On the plus side, the location on a beautiful beach was great.
title: Very disappointing

text:
Отель occidental 
Заявленная категория при заселении 5*
Мы заехали в номера 128 и 139 ночью, 05.01 примерно в 03.00
При заезде в номере 139 отсутствовал холодильник и дополнительное место для 3-го проживающего, унитаз был очень грязный, в номере 128 отсутствовало дополнительное место для 3-го проживающего!
В номерах при заезде было грязно, белье и полотенца темные, работала только одна розетка, полок нет вообще, одежду абсолютно некуда положить, в 139 номер не приносили зубные наборы и воду!
Входные двери в номера вздутые/деформированные от сырости, обои в номерах в темных пятнах от сырости!!!
По сути нам принесли не дополнительные кровати , а раскладушки со старыми дырявыми и вонючими матрасами, номера ужасно маленькие по площади , это максимум соответствует 3*

06.01 после неоднократных просьб нам предложили другие номера в этом отеле, но так как они не отличались , мы ОТКАЗАЛИСЬ ОТ ПЕРЕСЕЛЕНИЯ !
title: Никому не рекомендую!!!

text:
Last leg of our trip in Srilanka! We were so looking forward to these two days! Extremely disappointing! The room was good, view of the pool and a bit of the Indian Ocean visible from our room! The day we checked there was a party and the sound was so loud all the way up till late in the night! Pillows were another matter!! No sleep! 

We hoped for a good beach to relax before we headed back home! A very dirty beach! There were things washed up and not cleaned at all! Either they are short staffed or not used to giving the best hospitality! This place lacked everywhere! 

We had requested for a vegetarian food right throughout our trip and were never disappointed except for here. Food spread was good but hardly anything for vegetarians! And hospitality was at its lowest. Except for Dammika in the restaurant who was very attentive, it was as if no one really cared! Someone came up to us and told us that they would speak to the chef to organise some food but alas nothing came of it!! Just when we were heading out someone came in to ask if everything was ok!! 

The bathroom leaks. No one bothered to check. Cleaning service wasn’t great as the room was still sandy as ever. Ask for any extra coffee and it takes atleast two calls to the front desk! 

Overall wouldn’t recommend it at all! Avoid this property
title: Disappointing

roomTip: Don’t book room 247
text:
We’ve been to this hotel before and put off coming back for a while as we had a great time before with our family and didn’t want to lose that memory. Last time had a great room overlooking the sea. This time I chose garden view but that is not what we got! I booked the trip in January so I do not know why we were given the worst room in the hotel overlooking a concrete roof and service area of hotel. Our hearts sank. We were told the hotel was fully booked but later found out that some other guests that arrived same day but later than us managed to move to a different room. The hotel was mainly full with locals. 
The locals left after the weekend and this is when we were able to move to a room with a balcony. This room had a run down bathroom with peeling chrome, leaking toilet and a mouldy shower curtain. In the previous room the air con unit was leaking and I slipped over as there was a big puddle on the floor. 

The food was of a very good standard while the locals were there but when they left the standard dropped massively . I understand not as many dishes can be prepared for less guests but the standard should not drop. No longer were there tasty fried prawns or nasi goreng. Even the chicken curry disappeared. .
We did not enjoy a single meal after the locals left, just ate to fill our stomaches.

I booked a pedicure and was told they don’t have machine for gel nails but can do varnish which was fine I said. I was shown into a room with all the nail colours laid out. My feet were put in a bowl of cold water . The lady quickly gave a get a run over with an  emery board. Didn’t get rid of dry skin at all. Then a quick application of oil  no massage. I was then given a clear coat of varnish an told it was finished. I stated I wanted a colour but was told the varnish was old and no good. Another disappointment as I had stated before hand that I wanted varnish. My husband returned to the spa to check the price list. Then the lady approached us to say she would now give me a colour??? I wished I had refused to pay because it just wasn’t good enough.

The staff in hotel are wonderful. So keen to please. That’s the only positive I can say.

This is NOT a five star hotel by any means.
title: So disappointed

Occidental Eden Beruwala
placeInfo/address: Kaluwamodara, Beruwala 12070 Sri Lanka
text:
Safety and Security Alert: I strongly advise against staying at the Occidental Eden Hotel or any of the Barceló Hotel Group premises based on a dfisturbing robbery and burglury I was the victim of and the actions by hotel emeployees and management.
On May 25 a burglar climbed up on my balcony and entered my room at approximately 04:30 in the morning while I was sleeping. He stole a bag with my passport, driver’s license, and cash. While departing he made a noise and woke me, but I could not catch him as he jumped from the balcony unto a ledge and got away.
The very disturbing parts: 1. Hotel staff must have unlocked the balcony glass door as had locked it that morning. 2. The surveillance cameras were not working on my balcony. 3. The top bolt of the room door was removed. When the check in staff was asked for a change of rooms due to this, they said the hotel was completely booked up. This was later proven to be untrue. 4. The safe did not work properly until reprogrammed by staff after the robbery. 5. Hotel staff were seen carrying a ladder outside the hotel near my room near the time of the robbery. The cameras facing the side of the hotel with my room were off. 6. A hotel housekeeping staff was seen near my room door near the time of the robbery. 7. The hotel guard near my room facing the beach said he saw nothing. 7. After the robbery hotel staff asked me “why was I in Sri Lanka”. They also repeatedly asked me to claim the items were “lost and not stolen as this would be easier”. Hotel security told me they needed information for the police report and asked my “home address and mother’s maiden name”. As I was there for my company opening a branch in Beruwala the hotel management later said, “if we had known who you were we would have given you a room this would not have happened in”. The hotel security said if I offered a reward, I likely would get my passport back. I replied I don’t reward criminals. 8. The newspaper the Daily Mirror ran an article immediately and identified me as well as what was taken and inferred the items were ‘laying around”. The items were right next to me as I slept. When I sent a response and comments to the Daily Mirror the did not publish them. On Instagram they could not prevent my replies. 
The actions by the hotel staff from check-in, housekeeping, security, and all levels of management were highly suspicious and very disturbing. 
I strongly advise if you are going to the Beruwala area and especially if you are in the gem trade do not stay at the Occidental Eden Hotel for your personal safety and the security of your valuables. And after this experience I would avoid any hotel under the management of the Barceló Hotel Group.
title: Safety and Security Alert of Occidental Eden Beruwala - a Hotel of Theft

ownerResponse/text:

danke, dass Sie sich die Zeit für eine Bewertung genommen haben.

placeInfo/address: Kaluwamodara, Beruwala 12070 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Nicht buchen!
text:
Kurzbeschreibung:
- Zustand Zimmer gesundheitsgefährdend
- alles ist nass/ feucht, Schimmel Sicht- und deutlich riechbar 
- Klimaanlage schimmelt und verteilt Schimmelgeruch im Raum
- Klimaanlage tropft 

Alles ist nass und riecht nach Schimmel. Das Zimmer ist ebenfalls nicht mehr im besten Zustand. Auf Beschwerde wurden uns VIER verschiedene Zimmer als Tauschoption gezeigt. Die Hotelleitung hätte uns auch ein kostenloses Upgrade in die nächsthöhere Zimmerkategorie (renoviert) gegeben. Jedoch wiesen alle Zimmer das gleiche Problem auf. Teilweise sogar mit offensichtlichen großen schwarzen Schimmelflecken. Es wurde eine „Reinigung“ angeboten woraufhin wir erklären mussten, dass nur eine Sanierung oder Renovierung hilft und keine einfache Zimmerreinigung. Die Begründung des Managers hieß, dass „Asthma Patienten einen Raum ohne Tapete bekommen könnten“, dabei war auch im weiß gestrichenen Zimmer zu sehen, dass Schimmelflecken einfach nur mit Farbe übermalt werden.
Die Klimaanlage verbessert das Problem nur bedingt. Sie stinkt ebenfalls nach Schimmel und man sieht es auch offensichtlich, dass die Sporen dadurch verteilt werden. Außerdem tropft diese bei Benutzung den Zimmerboden voll. 
Man hat das Gefühl, dass man sich in ein nasses, klammes Bett setzt.
Wir baten darum das Hotel zu verlassen und unser Geld wieder zu bekommen. Da das Hotel über TUI gebucht ist, war dies leider nicht möglich. Wir entschieden uns in unserem Zimmer zu bleiben und der Manager bot uns ein Upgrade zur Halbpension an.
Nach einer Nacht im Hotel ist die Stimmung leider mehr als am Boden, alle sind mit Kopfschmerzen aufgewacht und der Urlaub ist gelaufen. So ein schlechtes Hotel hatten wir auf unser Rundreise durch Sri Lanka noch nie.
title: EINMAL UND NIE WIEDER!

roomTip: Personally I cannot recommend staying at this hotel and will not stay there again.
text:
- Window did not close 

-  My room was facing the street, nearby ventilation releasing discharge air of kitchen (s. pictures) - thus a very bad smell, very noisy, mosquitos in my room due to window not closing - could not sleep. 

-  The hotel was unable to repair the window, the employees at the reception did not take it seriously: I  made them aware of that on the first evening and after the failed try of what they called 'engineers' was left to sleep in this room. I was then offered one other room after I asked again after the first night which was in a bad condition with an open hallway on the ground floor in a worse category  than the one I had. According to the hotel there were no other rooms available but according to one of the biggest booking portals there were several rooms available (not just suites) so the hotel could have easily provided me with a different room of either the same or the next category above, but was probably hoping to rent them out with the upcoming weekend. They claimed there must be a mistake on the booking site but I checked several times and there were rooms available, even after I had made them aware of there still being rooms available, which would have given them the opportunity to correct this if it really was incorrect. The hotel has in the meantime claimed I was offered several other rooms of a higher category which I did not like, which is absolutely untrue and absurd. I was just offered this one other room of a worse category until I was then given a room of the same category on day 3.

- I was given stained bedsheets, the cleaning staff was so kind to change them but the hotel management should have disposed of stained sheets in the first place
 
-  This proves my overall impression of my stay there that the hotel is adhering to a policy of saving at all cost and dishonesty - ultimately at the customers' expense.

-  beach: wastewater directly in front of hotel spa is released onto beach and into ocean so I would recommend walking a little further also because it is directly situated at the mouth of a river
title: Defect Room / Bad customer service

ownerResponse/text:
Chère Guest,

Bien que nous soyons sincèrement désolés de lire votre déception sur votre séjour au sein de notre hôtel Occidental Eden Beruwala, A Member Of Barcelo Hotel Group, nous vous remercions pour vos commentaires qui nous aident à identifier les aspects sur lesquels nous devons travailler pour améliorer l'expérience de nos futurs hôtes.

Nous sommes ravis de lire que la courtoisie de notre personnel a été à la hauteur de vos attentes et qu'ils ont contribué à rendre votre expérience agréable. Nous tenons à les remercier pour leur dévouement et leur service attentionné.

Nous regrettons cependant que votre séjour ait été perturbé par le niveau sonore lors des événements du week-end et en semaine. Nous comprenons que le calme est précieux pour nos clients et nous prenons en compte vos remarques pour améliorer la gestion de nos espaces communs lors de réceptions privées. Concernant l'ambiance musicale au restaurant, nous allons revoir notre sélection afin d'offrir une atmosphère plus variée et apaisante. Nous sommes désolés pour le désagrément causé par la climatisation et la musique, et nous nous engageons à mieux équilibrer le confort de tous nos hôtes. Nous apprécions également vos commentaires sur les aspects éco-responsables de notre établissement et nous continuerons à travailler sur ces initiatives importantes. Enfin, nous sommes navrés d'apprendre que l'accord proposé n'a pas été respecté, et nous allons enquêter sur cette situation pour nous assurer que cela ne se reproduise plus.

Encore merci pour votre visite et vos axes d’amélioration, nous en tiendrons compte afin de poursuivre notre politique d’amélioration continue de la qualité des services que nous offrons à notre clientèle. 

Bien à vous,

The Management
placeInfo/address: Kaluwamodara, Beruwala 12070 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Il faut réserver sa chaise longue des 8h00
text:
Si vous êtes à la recherche de quiétude  (comme peut inspirer le Sri Lanka) je vous conseil de ne pas séjourner dans cet établissement.
Le week-end il reçoit dès CE sri lankais, en semaine des mariages ce qui génère beaucoup d’agitation et de nuisances sonores. 
Tout est basé sur le « bling-bling » façon bouliwood, il y a beaucoup de cache misère.
Au restaurant toujours la même musique en boucle matin, midi et soir à force il y a de quoi devenir fou. En ce qui concerne le restaurant il y a très peu de place en extérieur, la salle est un immense frigo qui fait caisse de résonance.
Il faut reconnaître la gentillesse des petites mains qui d’affaires au service, en cuisine, au jardin….ils sont vraiment adorables.
Le troisième soir, un des manager de l’hôtel demande à me voir pour faire suite à un commentaire que j’ai publié sur TripAdvisor. Il me demande des explications. Je lui explique qu’il n’est pas acceptable que le samedi la musique du bar sois à fond avec les portes grandes ouvertes et la climatisation à fond (pour un groupe hôtelier qui se veut éco-responsable). Il m’explique qu’il y avait le CE donc….au final le CE est plus important. Pour se faire excuser il me propose un deal en contre partie je dois supprimer mon avis. Bon je discute avec ma compagne qui me dit que j’ai peut être été un peu fort….je supprime donc mon avis, par contre lui n’a pas tenu son engagement. Très cher manager je tiens à vous dire que oui votre hôtel est à éviter si vous chercher de la tranquillité et du repos. Je vous recommande le Occidental Paradis ressort à Dambulla : ambiance zen, personnel au top et pas de bling bling.
title: Peu que mieux faire!

placeInfo/address: Kaluwamodara, Beruwala 12070 Sri Lanka
text:
Zunächst nachts bei Ankunft am Flughafen ein Anruf vom Reiseleiter!!!
Wir sollen keines Falles mit den am Strand ansässigen Tourguides Unternehmungen buchen, da dies Betrüger seien.
Mittlerweile und nach diversen Gesprächen mit anderen Gästen ist das Fazit genau umgekehrt.
Uns wurde vom Reiseleiter und vom Hotelguide das Geld aus der Tasche  gezogen..Bei einen durchschnittlichen Einkommen eines Singhalesen (230€) 180-150€ pro Person für einen Tagesausflug zu verlangen und zu argumentieren, dass man versichert sei, ist eine absolute Frechheit. Der Versicherungsfall ist eingetreten (Erkrankung) und wir bekamen lediglich 50% erstattet obwohl keinerlei Kosten entstanden sind.

Das erste Zimmer musste aufgrund der Lautstärke des Nachbarzimmers gewechselt werden, obwohl upgrade versprochen wurde gab es ein downgrade , das Zimmer war kleiner. 

Kurz vor Abreise war das Zimmer von insekten befallen obwohl wir die Türen geschlossen hielten.
Hier gab und der Manager für 2 Nächte die wir mit hunderten von geflügelten Ameisen verbracht haben 20% Rabatt auf die Getränke.
Zu den Getränken;
Ein Caipirinha ( kleines Glas) kostet etwa 8€
Eine Pepsi 4€

Wir werden aus vielerlei Gründen nicht wieder kommen
title: Insektenbefall im Zimmer, Betrug und dauerhafte Belästigung der Beachboys

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback regarding your stay at EKHO Lake House Polonnaruwa. I regret that we did not meet your expectations and that you left feeling disappointed with your experience.

While I am glad you appreciated the stunning location and the views from your room, I am sorry to hear about the plumbing issues and other inconveniences you encountered. I have shared your concerns with our maintenance team to address these problems immediately.

Regarding the pricing of beverages and food, we strive to maintain a balance between quality and value, but I understand your perspective. Your comments will be reviewed as we continuously evaluate our pricing to ensure a fair and enjoyable experience for our guests.

I also acknowledge your feedback about the pool size and lounging area. While our property emphasizes its heritage charm and lakeside tranquility, we will look into ways to enhance the relaxation spaces for our guests.

Queen Elizabeth’s visit in 1954 is indeed a cherished part of our history, but our goal is to create an experience worthy of the present, not just rely on the past. Your feedback serves as a valuable reminder that we have areas to improve, and I sincerely apologize for falling short during your visit.

Thank you once again for your honest feedback. Should you decide to visit Polonnaruwa again, I would be grateful for the opportunity to personally ensure a better experience for you.

Warm regards,
Nuwan Wijerathne
Resident Manager, EKHO Lake House Polonnaruwa
placeInfo/address: Pothgul Mawatha, Polonnaruwa 51000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Hate to say this but apart from the wonderful ruins of the ancient capital which are well worth a visit, the town is a bit of a dump.
text: Great location but that’s about it. The room was OK - nice view over the lake - but there were plumbing issues and a few other niggles. If you like warm beer at an extortionate price,  like LKR 1,900 for a Lion (over Stg £5 or US$6.50), this is the place to go. Food was OK but again very overpriced. And as for the pool, it’s hardly bigger than a jacuzzi and only one lounger so not much of a place to relax after a hard tour of the amazing ancient capital of Polonnaruwa. This hotel is living on its laurels. So Queen Elizabeth stayed here in 1954? Hope the beer or gin & tonic was chilled back then.
title: Overhyped and overpriced. Disappointing.

placeInfo/address: Pothgul Mawatha, Polonnaruwa 51000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The food served
text:
We initially planned to stay two nights at this hotel. But starting from dinner the food was not tasty. The soup had too much salt, the lamb was over roasted and some of the desert tasted as if it had gone bad. We politely raised our concerns but no substitute was offered. Neither was an apology. During lunch the next day, we were served spring rolls that were half fried. This time we complained to the manager. He offered to fix the problem but again the main dish was poorly prepared. This is quite disappointing as local travelers we accept a standard of taste. No substitute for the mistakes were offered and we were charged full amount. Once complained again they gave us 10% off. I wouldn’t recommend anyone to stay here for 3 full meals. The chef is incompetent and I honestly feel it’s a health risk to eat old food or undercooked food.

The view and the location of the hotel is great. But if there were other options near by this hotel would most probably not sustain.
title: Tasteless over cooked or burnt food

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Greetings from EKHO Lake house, We are a organisation which create a good name for keeping our guest satisfied from all aspects of hospitality and the our guest comment will surely prove our word. we always welcome constructive criticism as we believe its the pillar of success. bur anything beyond reality we believe must explained. 
you have reserved one room for 17th Feb from 03 different booking engines and has cancelled them,  but one booking engine is a prepay-ed ( its not ethical to mention the name) and  they must have surely deduct from your credit card as per their policy and we have not charged you for anything.

Further more we do not have any one by the name of Gina under our company or our hotel.
There for please be kind enough to remove this false review at your earliest with out misleading our valuable guest.

text:
Just be careful when you book this hotel. I booked with booking.com and it was my luck. 60 days before I cancelled my resevation since we could not make it anymore. (Onky needed to cancel a week before) 
The hotel even after I cancelled took the money of the entire stay off my credit card. Sent an email to the hotel and a lady named Gina, that I suppose is somehow responsible for answering the emails with this important issues says they did not charge anything,  oh , and I sent the hotel the bank extract when it appears the name of the hotel and much more information. So I contacted booking who were great. They returned my money but also told me that the hotel does not want to take responsibility for using my credit card when then could not, so booking just advanced the money, hope they can get it from the hotel! So, when you book this hotel always look your bank account because they use your money even if you cancel resevation or probably charge you for things you did not use.
title: CREDIT CARD ALERT. They charge your credit card with no authorization

placeInfo/address: Pothgul Mawatha, Polonnaruwa 51000 Sri Lanka
text:
This is a lovely hotel located right on the Parakrambahu Samudra. This is easily the best hotel to see the sites around here and the fact that you can see elephants from your room across the water body at sunset makes it nice. The rooms are all in good shape and the staff are fine. I went during off season as a walk in quest and the manager gave me a good deal. 

They will show you the suite Queen Elizabeth stayed in 1954 and give you a tour of the property. Wake up in the morning and go for a morning walk in the island group of monuments, located next door. The museum is also right here. Breakfast was fantastic.

So why 2 stars you ask? I had the most unexpected and unacceptable experience at checkout. At check in I had requested a late checkout to which the staff nodded and said ok. Come the day of check out, the same staff member changed his mind and asked me to leave early. I don’t think I am entitled to a late checkout, but if it is promised they better honour it. This incident alone left me with mixed feelings about this place and left me wondering if I want to come back again.
title: Lovely hotel, great location, staff are difficult

 There are electricity errors several times a day.

text: Rip off of the highest order. If you are Sri Lanka and if santa isn't filling your wallet avoid this place like the plague. Upon arrival, to our horror we were told that they only cater to prior orders and that we could have lunch if we paid and ordered before going site seeing in Polonnaruwa. We agreed and asked for the menu which was NUTS. Rice and curry was 2,000 per head. We were staying at a five star hotel and there, meals were priced at 700-1000 per head. This place is still a glorified road side rest House and charging fine dining rates for this sort of food is daylight robbery. Naturally we left, completed our site seeing and went back to water garden where we had a hearty lunch. I am disgusted to say the least. Shame on you, management at Ceylon Hotels Corporation!

roomTip: Avoid at all cost . Pathetic Rude Staff
text:
Our experience at Shangri-La Hambantota was far from what one expects from a luxury resort and left us with a lasting sense of frustration and disbelief.
We were travelling with young children after a 12-hour journey, hoping for a smooth and welcoming check-in. Instead, we were met with one of the most disorganized and poorly managed check-ins we’ve ever encountered. Despite informing the hotel in advance and requesting an expedited process, there was simply no manpower or urgency from the staff. Mr. Kamindu at the front desk was completely clueless and indifferent, showing little regard for basic hospitality. When we requested an upgrade, he first claimed there was no availability and moments later said upgrades were available for a price—an inconsistency that spoke volumes about their priorities.
The rooms allocated to us were at the very end of a long corridor, at least a 5-minute walk from the lobby—highly inconvenient for a family with small kids. Worse, the rooms were in noticeably poor condition and in no way reflected five-star quality.
When we raised these concerns with the duty manager, Mr. Lakmal, the situation only deteriorated. Instead of listening or showing any sense of accountability, he was rude, dismissive, and shockingly arrogant. He refused to help, refused to acknowledge the genuine concern of accessibility for a family with children, and instead blamed us for not requesting a “more convenient room” at the time of booking. He even had the audacity to suggest we pay for a higher category room if we wanted basic convenience.
It was a masterclass in how not to handle guest issues. Mr. Lakmal’s attitude was not just unprofessional—it was shameful for someone representing a global hospitality brand. Basic courtesy, empathy, and common sense were completely absent.
This experience has not only left us disappointed but also deeply disillusioned with the Shangri-La brand. What should have been a relaxing family getaway was marred by sheer negligence, apathy, and arrogance from key staff.
title: Extremely Disappointing Stay – Arrogant Management & Substandard Service

placeInfo/address: Sittrakala Estate Chithragala, Hambantota, Tangalle 82100 Sri Lanka
text:
Typical 3 star hotel. But only fakes them selves as 5 star. 
1. At check in we found out that main pool was close for the maintenance. We requested them to Atleast give us usage at adult pool , that also they said no, they tell use the baby pool for famiily , which was only 2.5 feet depth. We even requested room upgrade for which they told me it will take 2 more hours to ready those rooms. Which 5 star property does this. I have been to Mariott Welagama and Taj Bentota both were amazing but this Shangrila Hambantota is worthless in customer experience. 
2. Food I suggest only book if u are NON VEGETARIAN EATER. The. Buffet have very limited choise for vegetarian and Indian vegetarian there were only 3 items on menu. . 75% items are non vegetarian . Trust me guys Indian vegetarian will die with hunger here , Jain people please avoid this place the whole area smells of meat and fish products. No proper exhaust. Vegetarian specially jain this hotel is strict no no . The chef was pre informed about our dietary requirement . But we got 1 extra paneer vegetable for all that effort. The chef did favour on us by making that also. We requested to Atleast give one vegetarian pizza because we had no option on buffet to eat, but they said the pizza is not on buffet and chargeable. What type of hospitality is this . The manager should understand that they already have limited option and not able to eat and inspite of supporting they asked for money. Disgusting hospitality and the manger is worthless being a five star. . 
3. Morning breakfast had 3 veg items . Only inspire of head chef knowing there are vegetarian guest also after all discussion following dinner in the night. , still they could not bake us 1 or 2 eggless pastries. After some talk chef managed to do a favour again by bringing some from kitchen. These guys provide but first they spoil the mood by saying not there and than do us favour by providing little . They make channa masala and when u asked what to eat with , they told me with thick dosa. Is he really a chef or what . Who eats channa masala with dosa . They could have baked some puris with channa masala . Senseless and weird. Just hiding their inability to cater properly. 
4. No proper tagging of allergies on food items . Things that contain eggs are just named and no sign of any allergiens in food being a 5 star is shocking . Did they hire head chef someone from 3 star hotel . Some items have eggs and it’s mentioned other have eggs and still not mentioned . Is it some sort of joke. 
5. WiFi sucks . Rooms air conditioning sucks . Property is under lots of maintenance . 
6. Duty managers are sleeping and unresponsive. They keep u wait for 15- 20 min to meet with them. Like they have paid us money to come here and attend them. 
INSHORT ITS A PARADISE FOR NON VEGETARIAN EATERS. Vegetarian should refrain from booking. You pay so much in name if 5 star property and they have such low standard for customer satisfaction 

Shangrila Team please mention on website that u can’t provide and cater to vegetarian. Buffet should have Atleast 50% veg on menu. Including pastries also. Go green and start serving vegan and vegetarian. Just saving papers and washing powders won’t make u green.
title: POOR VARIETIES OF VEGETARIAN FOOD. BIG NO NO FOR JAIN , GUJARATHI AND Indian vegetarian

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Thilanka
Thank you for taking the time to share your detailed feedback. We offer our sincere apologies for the shortcomings you experienced during your stay. Please know that your concerns have been taken very seriously and have been thoroughly discussed at our operations meeting.

The relevant heads of department have been advised to take immediate corrective actions, and we are committed to ensuring such situations do not occur in the future. We truly value your insights and regret that we did not meet the standards expected of an international five-star experience.

General Manager
placeInfo/address: Sittrakala Estate Chithragala, Hambantota, Tangalle 82100 Sri Lanka
text:
As frequent international travellers to star class chain hotels, this hotel experience was far from five star experience. We visited right after the local new year and it was over crowded. Staff clearly looked overworked and always annoyed or just waiting for the day to get over. Ask them anything they are annoyed. Whether it was cutlery, plaster, water, slightly late checkout or whatever you ask, we had to either wait or they come back with some excuse why they cannot provide it. You’ll be surprised at the lack of interest to serve local guests. A Smile on their face is something you’ll rarely find. 

Room is spacious but the sofas and bathroom floor are full of stains. Shower area drain gives a foul smell when not in use. Buffet was repetitive. We stayed for two nights on full board basis and were regretting due to lack of choice. Restaurant staff are just running around and if you try stopping them for a second to ask something they get annoyed. I showed a table and asked if it’s available and one male staff member point blank told me that he doesn’t know. Another time I stopped another male staff to ask for something and he stopped me with a hand signal until he gave cutlery to another. Never seen such unfriendly and poor service in any other five star hotel anywhere in the world. There was one chef who came to the tables asking if everything is ok and that was it. 

Our 4YO kid had a cut on her foot near pool and when we asked pool side bar staff for a plaster they just waited for a while and came back and said they don’t have plasters. They told us to go to the nurse and get plasters ourselves and said they are not allowed to ask for plasters from the nurse. My husband was annoyed since they took long to just say this and also we saw them passing the ball to each other who would go and say no to us. We were seated very close to the bar. When we asked the nurse if there is such policy that staff cannot ask for a plaster from the nurse for a guest, she said there is no such policy. What a lie!!!

 High time you give your staff a training or give them a proper rest or raise so they won’t be this frustrated and offer bad service all the time. 

Both my husband and I are premium category members of Hilton, Marriott and have experienced stays around the world but membership is so worthless and means nothing at Shangri-la Hambantota. They will follow the checklist and give you a proactive call to ask your preferences but make zero effort to fulfil it. They will also call you in the middle of the stay but again for checklist but won’t listen to what the member has to say. Will just say ok ok and hang up. Please stop calling your regular members to ask their preferences if you cannot meet them. Don’t set expectations if you cannot meet them. Waste of time for the hotel and member both.

We booked with my husband’s membership number and someone called him two days before asking our preference and for us it was kids pool access and higher floor. Day of the check in, we called the call Center to check our stay while we were driving there and the agent told us our room was assigned and  it was a number on 3rd floor. When we arrived, they have clearly stroke off the room number given to us by call Center and given us a lower floor room which we could see on the paper they gave us for signing. Then when we told them about this, they put us to a different room which was even further away from kids pool and on a lower floor. Finally they gave us a 4th floor room which was worn out. Also we checked out from Shangri-la app and were told that app is not in sync with hotel system. We had unpaid pool side bills and we could’ve left without knowing this.  

Please learn and upgrade membership service quality standards from other chain hotels operating in Sri Lanka like Marriott, who are genuinely making an effort when a member show up. Premium category or otherwise. If not scrap the membership so we will not expect international level experience from you or choose another international brand. 

Differential treatment for local guests was pretty obvious. The property was over crowded with locals so staff had differential and derogatory attitude towards local guests and ignored  most of the time  from front desk, room service, restaurant etc. which wasn’t the case for foreign guests. Giving a special local offer does not give you permission to treat locals with lower quality service. We didn’t ask for the discounted price at poor quality service. 

Only good things were the village area and kids play area and kids pool. Life guards were good, attentive and very friendly. Rest is 3 star service disguised in Shangri-La brand. 

If you’re a local who knows what international chain hotel brands offer, then rethink before you come here as it is not going to be a five star experience. Definitely not international. We won’t be back till we hear of tangible improvements.
title: Not the International Shangri-La experience. Specially not for the local guests.

text:
Extremely disappointed with our stay. So overrated, poorly maintained property with exorbitantly priced food. Absolutely zero variation in three consecutive dinner and breakfast buffets. The kids buffet section was a joke both dinner and breakfast there was only starch and vegetables. No meat items. We ordered room service and paid exorbitant prices for basic food which were bland and easily could have been made at home for 1/10th the price.

Only a boy called Ranepura was very nice, along with majority of the staff. There were a few staff on the other hand who were pompous because we are locals. I noticed even in the kids play area there were many instances where foreign kids were prioritized and given more attention. Play area was a joke!! It's absolutely filthy!!!! Doesn't look like the place has gotten a deep clean in years.. I have been to three star hotels with better and cleaner common facilities.

I wouldn't be so annoyed if we didn't have to waste so much money on such a mediocre experience at a so called 5 star hotel - I'd like to see the criteria that make this hotel a 5 star hotel and see how it's continuously assessed and updated. 

We will never recommend or ever be coming again. However hope you'll would improve yourselves, or I would suggest reducing the star rating of your hotel.
title: Terrible Experience

text:
We expected a luxurious and hassle-free stay, but instead, we faced poor management, overcharging, and unprofessional service.

First, the booking process was a disaster. We originally booked a Premier Ocean King Double Room and a Premier Ocean King Triple Room for LKR 56,550 and LKR 62,400 after a 35% discount. A few days before arrival, we needed to upgrade to a triple room. Instead of a simple amendment, we were forced to make a completely new reservation. Despite a 20% local resident discount, we were charged LKR 74,400 for a Deluxe Double Room—a lower category than our original booking! If that wasn’t bad enough, we had to pay for 7 people, even though we were only 6, because there were no single rooms. Completely unreasonable.

Then came the restaurant fiasco. We were told to wait 15 minutes outside, which we agreed to. But instead of honoring this, the receptionists let in other guests who arrived after us! We even saw a group of five being quietly told to enter in pairs to get ahead. After waiting patiently, we had to demand a table, which should never happen at a hotel of this reputation.

The lack of attention to guest needs was another huge disappointment. We requested shaving kits—called multiple times—but they were never delivered. Then, at checkout, despite several reminders, no one came to collect our baggage. We had to carry our own luggage to the reception. Ironically, a staff member picking up baggage from another room told us that his team was never even informed about our request!

The problem isn’t the staff—the ones we encountered were polite, but they were clearly exhausted. This is a management failure. If the hotel can’t handle the number of guests they book, they should stop overbooking.

This was meant to be a special celebration for our father’s birthday, but instead, it was a frustrating experience filled with unfair pricing, disorganization, and ignored requests. Definitely not the standard expected from Shangri-La.
title: Overbooked, Overpriced & Overwhelmingly Disappointing

Shangri-La is a beautiful property, but unfortunately, our experience was not up to the expected standard due to booking issues, overpricing, and service failures.

We originally booked a Premier Ocean King Double Room and a Premier Ocean King Triple Room with a 35% discount. Despite a 20% local resident discount, we were charged LKR 74,400 for a Deluxe Double Room, which is a lower category than what we had originally booked. This felt unjustified, and we were also required to pay for 7 people, even though we were a group of 6, simply because there were no single rooms.

Dinner service was frustrating. We were asked to wait 15 minutes, which we understood given how busy the hotel was. However, we were left waiting much longer, while multiple guests who arrived after us were seated first. One group of five was even told by the receptionist to split into pairs and enter quietly—which felt completely unfair.

placeInfo/address: Sittrakala Estate Chithragala, Hambantota, Tangalle 82100 Sri Lanka
text:
We recently stayed at Shangri-La and had a disappointing experience, from overcharging to poor service at both the restaurant and during checkout.

Booking Issues

We initially booked one Premier Ocean King Double Room and one Premier Ocean King Triple Room, costing LKR 56,550 and LKR 62,400 after a 35% discount. A few days before arrival, we needed to amend our booking to upgrade the double room to a triple room. However, we were told that amendments were not possible and that we had to make a completely new reservation.

Despite the 20% local resident discount offer, we were charged LKR 74,400 for a Deluxe Double Room, which is a lower category than our originally booked Premier Ocean King rooms. The pricing seemed significantly off, and it felt like we were overcharged. Additionally, we had to pay for 7 people, even though we were only a group of 6, because single rooms were unavailable. Since we were celebrating our father’s birthday, we had no choice but to proceed.

Restaurant Experience

Our frustration didn’t end with the booking. On the night of our stay, we arrived for dinner and were asked to wait outside for 15 minutes before being seated. We understood that the hotel was busy and waited patiently. However, even after 15 minutes, we were still not let in, while other guests who arrived after us were seated before us.

We even saw a group of five whom the receptionist secretly instructed to enter in smaller groups of two. At this point, we had no choice but to speak up to get a table. This was highly unprofessional and unacceptable—especially given that we had paid for 7 people, but they couldn’t even accommodate our actual group of 6.

Service Issues – Missing Requests & Checkout Problems

The lack of attention to guest requests was another major disappointment. We requested shaving kits since they were not available in the room, but despite calling multiple times, we never received them.

During checkout, no one came to collect our baggage from the rooms, despite multiple reminders. We had to carry our own bags to the reception. A staff member who happened to be picking up baggage from a nearby room kindly helped two of us. He mentioned that his team was never informed about our baggage collection request, which shows a clear lack of coordination.

Final Thoughts

While most of the staff were kind and helpful, they seemed overworked and overwhelmed. This is not their fault—this is a management issue. The hotel should either allocate adequate staff or limit the number of bookings to ensure proper service for all guests.

What was supposed to be a special celebration turned into an unnecessarily stressful experience due to poor booking policies, questionable pricing, disorganized restaurant service, and unresponsive housekeeping. We truly hope the management takes these concerns seriously and improves their service to meet the high standards expected from a hotel of this caliber.
title: Disappointing Experience with Overcharging and Poor Service

text:
Hôtel à éviter. La restauration est très basique et propose chaque soir de rang les mêmes plats , pas de variante. Et pour manger à l extérieur, il faut mieux arriver à 19h précise. Le nettoyage des chambres est très sommaire et parfois effectué à la va vite. La plage face à l hôtel est très peu fréquentée car beaucoup de remous et dangereuse
 Un golf de 19 trous présent dans l hôtel , mais personne ni joue!!!!. Pour un hôtel resort et golf et spa, il y a largement mieux que celui ci. Beaucoup de personnels mais cela manque de compétence et service. Pour moi, cette hôtel est rayée de ma carte de globe 🌎 trotter. The French Man.

text:
Holiday inn quality and service with name of Shangri La. The five star reviews here are mostly fake ( check how many reviewers ) will report to Shangri La HQ and to Trip advisor. 

In summary hotel is old and run down and needs major renovation. Service is at 2 star level. You need to remind them multiple times for your requests of which many go unfulfilled. 

Room is old and outdated with fungus in bathrooms. Beds are dirty and old. See photos. 

Windows of rooms are old and don’t lock well hearing noise from outside non stop. 

Pools : 3 pools are nice. Service on pool is slow and takes 30 minutes. They run out of towels and simple sometimes you just have to dry without a towel ( happened often in adult pool)

The bar of the adult pool. While they prepare the cocktails the bar tender puts the spoon in his mouth to taste as he uses it in the drinks. 

Breakfast area is like a bazaar. No place to sit and hundreds of people. They run out of coffee often and you need to wait 15 minutes for refills of coffee. 

Over all food in hotel is average. Service is poor. 

We won’t come back again unless it’s fully refurbished. I don’t know how Shangri La accepts such low quality hotels and service in their chain using their name.
title: A Holiday Inn quality and service with Shangri La name and prices. Run down  hotel and rooms with nightmare service

General Manager
placeInfo/address: Sittrakala Estate Chithragala, Hambantota, Tangalle 82100 Sri Lanka
text:
One of the worst hotels I have stayed in for a long time. 

We paid for the full board dine around package yet had to fight for the right to eat at any other resturant than the main buffet restaurant. This resturant must have THE most un-imaginative, lazy executive chef on the planet. Breakfast is the same, day in, day out, seriously no changes and the coffee is awful. The juices are not much better. Yes Sri Lanka is an Asian island but the lunch menu is 90% curry, as is the dinner menu - seriously????  Currently sitting in the New Year's Eve gala dinner, which has a route 68 theme. No, I haven't heard of route 68 neither. I had to spit the sushi back onto my plate as I came close to vomiting, it was old and not freshly prepared. 

The main bar has plenty of room for more tables, yet is full with just a few tables and nowhere other than 2 bars to go to in the rain. Both have limited space.

The hotel made mistakes to my bill and I had to go through each item with a fine tooth comb to counter the mistakes. 

The food menus in the two bars lack imagination, and the 'selection' is minimal. The Chinese restaurant has great tasting food, but the service is SLOW. The staff stand around chatting. It took them 10 minutes to bring a menu, one hour for the food and even longer for the first round of drinks. 

There are a few waiting staff who care but most are poorly trained and start serving part of an order, then get distracted with someone else's and you have to ask for certain things in the pool bar at least twice before you get what you asked for

I will say that the room was clean and well appointed but that's the only highlight. Everything else is shockingly bad. 

There are spaces for shops but NONE are open. Be sure to bring enough sun cream and swimwear, you won't find anywhere even close to the hotel to buy any. 

Stay at this hotel at your peril and I will be amazed if Shangri-La associate their brand with this hotel for much longer. It is FAR from a five star hotel, three at best. We are very well travelled so we have stayed at a lot of good hotels to compare. 

I could go on and on but I doubt they will even read this review nor care!
title: Poor beyond belief

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Brian,
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback regarding your recent stay with us. I want to extend our sincere apologies for the various inconveniences you experienced, which clearly fell short of the Shangri-La luxury that you were expecting and that we strive to provide.

Regarding the room allocation, I understand your disappointment in not receiving the quiet room you requested. Unfortunately, due to high demand and the unavailability of our Premier Ocean View rooms, we had to allocate you a room near families. I’m truly sorry for the disturbance this caused.

I’m also deeply concerned to hear about your experience with food poisoning after dining in the sports bar. Please know that we take such matters very seriously. An immediate investigation has been initiated by our Hygiene Manager, and preliminary records have been taken and sent for further clarification. We are committed to ensuring the highest standards of food safety, and we will keep you informed of the findings.

With regard to the adults-only infinity pool, I apologize that this policy was not adequately enforced during your stay. All colleagues have been reminded to politely inform adults with children to use other pools designated for family use, ensuring that the tranquility of the adults-only pool is maintained.

I’m also sorry to hear about the service lapses you encountered, from the delayed and incorrect room service order to the poor breakfast service. These are certainly not the standards we uphold, and I will address these issues with the relevant departments to prevent such occurrences in the future.

Lastly, I regret that our calls regarding your stay and the timing of luggage assistance felt overbearing, especially the late-night call on your final evening. We will review our procedures to ensure that we provide attentive yet unobtrusive service.

Once again, I apologize for the shortcomings during your stay. Your feedback is invaluable in helping us improve, and I hope you will give us another opportunity to provide you with the luxury experience you deserve.

Refhan Razeen
General Manager
placeInfo/address: Sittrakala Estate Chithragala, Hambantota, Tangalle 82100 Sri Lanka
text:
Was expecting typical Shangri-La luxury, sadly this hotel has seen better days.

The room was dirty with a worm headboard (see picture), which certainly did not make me wish to sit up in bed!!

I asked for a quiet room and was allocated a room between two families, so not quiet at all. 

I ate fish tacos in the sports bar on night one and spent all day in bed on day two with food poisoning thus missing the reason for staying, which was to play golf. 

The staff were hit and miss, some good, others not. My partner ordered room service and had to ask twice where it was as it took so long (45mins plus). When it arrived, the order was incorrect!

There is a lovely adults only infinity pool, unfortunately the 'adults only' bit is not policed and children were often in the pool. 

Breakfast service was poor on the only day I got there. No cups/mugs for hot drinks, which meant tea/coffee arrived 25 minutes after we did. I don't know about you but I prefer to have my coffee with my breakfast, not after it. 

Overbearing at times, the room telephone is not there for you to keep calling and asking how my stay is and I certainly did not appreciate a call at 2100hrs on the final night asking what time I wanted luggage assistance in the morning. 

All of this during low occupancy so I dread to think what it is like when full.
title: In need of a refresh

text:
I recently stayed at the Shangri-La Hambantota from June 21st to June 23rd, 2024, and unfortunately, the experience ended on a very sour note due to the hotel's poor handling of an important issue.

After checking out, my husband realized he had left his wedding ring in the room. We immediately contacted the hotel's support team via WhatsApp to report the loss and requested that they check the room. Despite multiple follow-ups, the hotel failed to provide any timely or meaningful updates.

What was most frustrating was the complete lack of communication and urgency from the hotel's side. A thorough check of the room should have been conducted within 24 hours of our report, yet it took weeks to receive a vague response that they were unable to locate the ring. This was after we had to repeatedly chase them for updates.

The ring holds immense sentimental value as it was engraved with our wedding date, yet the hotel's after-sales support was shockingly inadequate. Instead of resolving the issue promptly, the hotel allowed it to drag on without proper follow-up or communication, leaving us deeply disappointed.

For a hotel that prides itself on luxury and exceptional service, this experience was far from it. I would not recommend Shangri-La Hambantota to anyone who values prompt and professional customer service.
title: Disappointing Experience at Shangri-La Hambantota

We were not expecting such unsatisfactory service from a reputed chain such as Shangri-La.
From the check in until we got our room changed, we had such an unpleasant experience. During the check in we had to wait with no one attending to us at the lobby. The staff had entirely forgotten about the check in until I had to inquire from the front desk. No welcome drinks were offered until I requested. And I had to go back and forth carrying a baby to complete the check in.
We checked in at the Araliya suite to find out that the shower drain wasn't draining the dirty water. After complaining about it they made arrangements to wipe out the shower area without fixing the drain. That's when we finally decided to check out that evening. Upon informing the staff, the management offered us a separate room with free meals as we had booked our room on BB. We decided we didn't want to utilize the free buffet option as an entire day of our vacation was already wasted. And we checked out the next day itself even if we had planned to stay for 2 nights.
The management had decided to waive off our ala carte charges when we check out. 
Additionally we observed that the rooms were not well maintained, wooden frame pieces of the Araliya suite's shower area were falling off and the bathrooms gave out a stong pungent smell.
title: Not recommended.

placeInfo/address: Sittrakala Estate Chithragala, Hambantota, Tangalle 82100 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Mostly suitable for local families who do not have 5* expectations, and are satisfied with eating the same food every day.
text: Sadly, this was a very poor experience and not the 5* hotel standard any holiday maker would expect. From the food to the general service, the week-long stay was nothing short of disappointing and frustrating. Most of the staff were kind and hospitable, though suffered from lack of training and understanding of the basics of hotel service. I am a solo traveler, something the staff could not understand or respect through shocked reactions and nervous laughter which was extremely uncomfortable and unpleasant. The hotel was overrun with many loud local families and young children, even in 'adult only' areas i.e. pool. Little to no information was provided at check-in about hotel services. Despite opting for the half-board package, I was initially told the restaurant was full on my first night (catering to 700+ guests for Sri Lankan new year). It was chaos. And things went downhill from there; errors with billing; sub par room service offerings which had food items missing or not matching the menu when served; an extremely basic and repetitive breakfast and dinner buffet (from which I caught food poisoning); staff hanging up the phone when not understanding me; and the list goes on. This is the first time I have ever felt compelled to write a negative review about a hotel, despite travelling solo across numerous countries. It is also the first time that I tried to cut short a holiday because I was so unhappy with the experience. Credit be due to the F&B Director who tried his best to rectify the situation when acknowledging all that had gone wrong. However, it was too little too late. My first visit to Sri Lanka was completely tainted by this badly, badly managed hotel which should absolutely not be labelled as a 5* luxury hotel. Far from it, unfortunately.
title: This is not a 5* hotel

text:
We booked a suite at Sheraton Kosgoda for a family stay, expecting a comfortable and hassle-free experience. However, from the moment we arrived, it was nothing but disappointment.

We reached the hotel around 2:30 PM, understanding that the standard check-in time was 3:00 PM. However, despite waiting in the lobby until then, the receptionist informed us that our room would take an additional 15 minutes. Instead of allowing us to wait in a comfortable space, we were sent to the pool area, which was unbearably hot and lacked proper seating—especially challenging when traveling with kids. Frustrated, we returned to the lobby, only to continue waiting until 3:50 PM for our room to be ready.

Upon finally entering the room at 4:00 PM, our disappointment only grew. The so-called suite was far smaller than expected. Based on the hotel’s website, a suite should be around 49m², but this particular ground-floor room clearly didn’t match those specifications. While that was partially our oversight for not checking photos in detail beforehand, the real issues began once we entered.

The room was extremely hot, and even after switching on the AC, there was no cooling effect after 30 minutes. We called for a technician at 5:30 PM, and by that time, I personally spoke to the front desk manager, who assured us of a room change and promised compensation in the form of full board and late checkout. However, even by 8:00 PM, the AC was still not functioning properly. Thankfully, the outside temperature cooled down at night, but by morning, the room became unbearably warm again. At that point, we didn’t even bother calling maintenance, as having a technician come in and out of such a small, congested space—especially with kids—would have only added to the inconvenience.

Having stayed at numerous Sri Lankan hotel chains, traveling almost every month, this was by far the worst experience we’ve had. To make matters worse, when we inquired about the full board compensation the next day, another manager dismissed it, saying we were only eligible for a late checkout.

This hotel’s service is highly unprofessional, and the way families are treated is unacceptable. I strongly advise anyone considering a stay here—especially families—to thoroughly check the hotel photos and reviews before booking. We expected a premium experience from Sheraton, but what we received was a complete disaster.
title: A Highly Disappointing Experience – Not Recommended for Families

text: In die Jahre gekommenes Hotel, Zimmer dennoch relativ neu, wahrscheinlich renoviert. Sehe unbequeme, viel zu weiche Matratzen. Die Rooftop-Bar ist akustisch vom Hotel nicht getrennt und spielt die ganze Zeit Technomusik, teilweise schreien Leute laut herum, man hört im Zimmer sogar den Mixer der Cocktails. Bis spät in die Nacht kein Schlafen möglich aufgrund der Lautstärke. Der Strand ist relativ menschenleer und naturbelassen. Die Liegen vor dem Hotel am Strand müssen extra bezahlt werden. Beim Zimmer inkludiert sind nur die Liegen am Pool, wobei auch hier permanent laute Musik läuft. Im Spa war keine Pediküre möglich, da angeblich die Utensilien fehlten. Wir kommen nicht mehr. Schade, da der Strand schön ist.
title: Überteuert, laut, Hotel veraltet
