placeInfo/address: Veyangoda Rd, Katunayake, Negombo 94000 Sri Lanka
text:
Recently stated there due to a flight delay from Dubai,would not complain on the property because I was put there by Sri Lankan air.However the service and food selection was a disaster and I would recommend that Air Sri Lanka is looking into the problem.
Food was left open with no chilling facilities,hot selection was curry and rice,but most of the layover guest were Western,only water was offfered and drinks such a a diet coke was charged at a price of 3 Euro,coffee was disgusting.
Hope Air Sri Lanka can solve this for future guest who have to stay there by no choice..
title: Poor food and service

placeInfo/address: Veyangoda Rd, Katunayake, Negombo 94000 Sri Lanka
text: Our tour company had paid extra for us to be picked up at the airport by Tamarind Tree.  The hotel did not pick us up at all.  We were left in the lurch and had to have airport staff call the hotel.  Our tour company had also arranged for us to have a king-size bed and when we finally got there we had twin beds.  Obviously not a good start.  I will say that the hotel staff was chagrined at these misssteps and did offer us a cocktail.  When I said that was not sufficient they threw in a free dinner.  The room we stayed in was large, but a little dated.  Unforunately, the only air conditioning was in the bedroom.  Everywhere else was an oven.  The hotel is located near the airport so that is a plus.
title: Could be better, could be worse!

placeInfo/address: Veyangoda Rd, Katunayake, Negombo 94000 Sri Lanka
text: Nice and quiet place with a huge garden. Would have been excellent for a weekend family outing if the staff was more efficient. Food is ok, but does not meet the expectations of the price tag. The weekend buffet is average however costs as much as a 5 star hotel in Negambo.
title: Nice place, OK food but expensive for the price you pay

placeInfo/address: Veyangoda Rd, Katunayake, Negombo 94000 Sri Lanka
text:
Had to be here for the second time. Peaceful atmos in a busy town - fine. Facilities OK, rates towards high side. Good food. But, extremely hopeless staff! Last time the front desk took ages to finish the bills at check-out. This time they seriously ignored a bathroom repair for a whole day! We had to go after the staff for supplies during the tea breaks.. I offered to work part time for the staff during my stay, if they were that understaffed!! Disappointing.. 
Oh, almost forgot.. The room smells moldy and spent the last night coughing... Uggghhhhh!!!
title: Lovely environment, good food but hopeless staff!

ownerResponse/text:
Hi
Thanks for your review. The name Asbestos for the roofing is misleading. The roofing is made of corrugated fibre cement. Asbestos is not used anymore since decades, only the name is still used for this type of roofing.
We offer both toast bread and local white bread for breakfast. As most guests request toast bread it's the default, but local white bread is available.
Enjoy your holiday in Sri Lanka and thanks for visiting Jungle Paradise
placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
Quiet tidy place but some things to fix;
Asbestos roofs. 
No closets or hanger space for clothes.
Food - wonderbread for guests, unsliced for owners. Jam with food coloring. 
Front desk - Chanukah is wonderful and holding the whole place together.
title: Jungle Paradise resort

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
roomTip: The entire place. There are better places nearby that don’t cost as much.
text:
Stayed here with my wife in late May of 2023. I’m dumbfounded at seeing the glowing reviews.
Perhaps pre-COVID this place was a palace.
When we arrived, we were greeted by friendly staff, however, walking to our room we felt something was off. Lots of bare concrete, akin to a low-security prison complex. The views from the room were…basic. It was effectively just bracken and bush. The bedroom and bed was full of bugs, perfect for people who want to to be bitten, or want extra crunch when they roll over in the night.
The shower came off the wall in my hand.
The internet was insufficient. Given it’s locality, one is basically trapped inside the compound, and expected to pay through the nose for low-quality food. Menu highlights include french fries for nearly 2000 rupees, and  plain spaghetti. When I enquired further, I was relieved to find out I could order a separate sauce. Delightful, I’m sure.
Oh, and each and every time I bothered the ‘helpful’ staff for anything; bottle of coke etc, I was expected to pay a service charge.
My advice; avoid. If not, order everything all at once.
The cat was cute, but I don’t think it has any managerial skills. Shame. He’d be better at it.
title: Prardoxial Paradise

placeInfo/address: 2066 1/2 Ekamuthugama, Usweliara, Udawalawa 70190 Sri Lanka
text:
Maybe stuff has changed. Maybe this place has got old but I trusted the reviews for this one and BOY could I not have been more naive. An absolute soulless, personality free white complex, that looked nothing like the pictures,
had no redeeming features and was about
as relaxing as taking cyanide. Our room was
crawling with bugs, mainly on the bed so we
ended up sleeping on their squashed corpses
The mossie nets did nothing -I had stuff
crawling over me all night. I'm aware we are in
the jungle but I've stayed in a tent in the middle
of the Amazon, a rainforest in Borneo and a
wooden shack in the Yucatan and a boat on
the Ganges that wasn't this awful. I was itching
all night. The place looks like a grey, flower free
concrete prison compound, with a dirty, pit like pool slap bang in the middle for your to awkwardly sit at and stare at nothing while the staff walk past. The balcony has hard, had cushion less wooden chairs that looked into bracken, mud and stuff they were building. No
idea which hut had 'views?' all the power went
off randomly in the night. The shower barely
worked (couldn't get the rainforest head to run
any warm water so had to use the power free
handheld bit), metal bits kept falling off it and at one point it just completely fell off the wall (picture included). 
The food was nice but three times the price of
anywhere else in Sri Lanka as they know you are
stuck in the middle of nowhere. As an example
a side of fries cost nearly 6 dollars. Another 
delicacy' was a plate of plain pasta without sauce. No joke. The fact this place was 50 or so bucks (without add on) a night begs belief, it was worth about 20 and that's being
kind. I've stayed in better hostels. The rooms The rooms are sparse with no free toiletries and one pillow each. I've never felt more mislead by reviews and the photos of a pretty flowery garden that didn't exist. We were meant to stay two nights but barely lasted one. We cancelled our planned safari too as I wanted to run away screaming and also dread to think how bad that would have been. It was the most disheartening place we have stayed in our month in Sri Lanka. Never believing reviews or heavily filtered photos again. - a proper insta vs reality scenario I wish hadn't been privy to. Overall, one night, a meal for 2, a couple of drinks, in dumpy cell ended up costing nearly 85 dollars (every single time someone brings something to your room, however small - you get charged). I'm revolted with my experience and wish I'd asked for compensation
title: Our worst experience in Sri Lanka - ugly room, broken shower, a view of mud, soulless rooms, crawling with bugs and unbelievably

roomTip: Nicht dieses Hotel buchen! Wenn der Preis für die Übernachtung zu gering ist, storniert das Hotel kurzfristig.
text:
Achtung!!! Vorsicht!!! ⚡ Meine Reservierung wurde wie bei anderen Gästen auch, ohne Grund 6 Wochen im voraus willkürlich storniert. Natürlich kann ich das gleiche Zimmer für den doppelten Preis erneut buchen. 😡 Solch eine unseriöses Hotel habe ich noch nie erlebt. An Frechheit und Preistreiberei kaum zu überbieten. Ich kann nur jedem dringend empfehlen, dass Hotel nicht zu buchen, wenn man eine sichere Übernachtung benötigt. Ärgerlich ist , dass logischer Weise 6 Wochen vor Anreise im allgemeinen die Preise für Übernachtungen gestiegen sind.
Danke!!! 🙏🙏🙏
Auf mehrfachen E-Mails wurde absolut nicht reagiert. Ich habe zweimal in diesem Hotel angerufen und jedes Mal wurde ohne Grund aufgelegt, wenn die Frage nach der Stornierung kam.
.
.
Liebes Management! Bitte kein blablabla wie bei den anderen Gästen. Bitte kopieren sie nicht wie überall irgendwelche Texte als Antwort. Die Gäste kommen zu ihnen um ihr Land kennen zu lernen und geben viel Geld dafür aus. Sie beleidigen Gäste, wenn sie aus finanzieller Gier Buchungen stornieren. Das ist keine Gastfreundschaft die für ihr Land steht. Sie brauchen nicht antworten mit einer nicht ernst gemeinten Entschuldigung, sie überprüfen die Angelegenheit und ich soll ihnen eine E-Mail senden. Ich bin nicht der einzige mit dem gleichen Problem. Ihre Antwort ist immer die selbe und nichts ändert sich. Bitte gehen sie mit ihren Gästen respektvoll um.
title: Vorsicht! Finger weg von diesem Hotel! Kurzfristige Stornierung ohne Grund!

placeInfo/address: No 10 Glenfall Road Nuwara Eliya, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
I booked a stay at Araliya Green Hills Hotel with high expectations, only to be utterly disappointed by their unprofessional and unethical practices. Just a day before my check-in, I received a notification that my booking was canceled – not due to any fault of mine, but because the hotel decided to increase the rate from the time of booking. This is completely unacceptable!

I had confirmed my booking well in advance, and to have the hotel arbitrarily cancel it at the last minute simply because they wanted to charge me more is not only frustrating but also a clear lack of respect for their guests. There was no effort to find a solution or offer an alternative accommodation – just a cold and indifferent cancellation email.

This experience has completely ruined my trust in the hotel and left me scrambling for another place to stay at the last minute. I highly advise anyone considering booking here to think twice. It's clear that customer satisfaction is not a priority at Araliya Green Hills.

It seems like most of the review with 5 rating are fake and not reliable.
title: Extremely Disappointed – Worst Hotel Experience

text:
Extremely Bad Experience. Not recommended for Overseas travelers.

We had booked this property in advance via Agoda from 24th Dec for 2N.
We reached Nuwara Eliya on 24th evening around 7pm and the hotel informed that they had cancelled all bookings via Agoda due to some payment issue with the company.

Well, they should have just delisted their property on Agoda in that case rather than causing a nightmare for the guests during busy holiday season. Not to say ruining our Christmas eve. 

Thankfully, they had availability in more expensive segment. We went with the same.
Price was much cheaper than Agoda- They had still not delisted and continued to take bookings!!

Room was comfortable. Heater was not very effective though.

The staff was extremely rude and seem to prefer only Sri Lankan guests.
They refused to pack breakfast for the early morning trek at Hortons Plains- which is quite common and given.

The lady manager created a ruckus for checking out at 12:15pm rather than 12Noon. 15minutes!! which they completely ruined our christmas eve.
title: Extremely Rude staff. Not recommended for Overseas travellers.

text:
We had quite some expectations after reading all the positive reviews but were very disappointed as soon as we arrived. The hotel has no atmosphere at all, very large furniture in the lobby and bar and very bright light everywhere. 
We checked the excellent reviews on Tripadvisor again and found out that all people had only written one review since they joined Tripadvisor….which was a review of this hotel.

The fitness is good, service at the reception, bar (Sha Shiranga) and restaurant (Madhu) was good as well. Rooms are spacious but everything else  is weird and not inviting at all. Food at the buffet was tasteless and below all standards. We were very disappointed and had a feeling we were staying in a hotel in Uzbekistan instead of being in a hotel in this small lovely town Nuwara Eliya.

roomTip: À éviter
text:
À notre arrivée, tout semblait parfait avec de petits salons accueillants et un service de thé avec toutes les explications nécessaires. Cependant, une fois dans notre chambre, nous avons constaté que la télévision ne fonctionnait pas. Ne parlant pas anglais, je n’ai pas souhaité contacter la réception, mais après 20 minutes de manipulation avec la télévision et le décodeur, j’ai réussi à la remettre en marche.

Nous avons ensuite voulu boire un verre à l’étage indiqué, mais il n’y avait personne pour nous servir. À cet endroit se trouvait également la piscine, qui paraissait agréable sur les photos, mais elle s’est révélée petite et froide.

Un autre point à noter est que pour accéder à l’espace spa, nous avons dû utiliser la lampe de notre téléphone car le couloir n’était pas éclairé.

Pour le dîner, nous sommes descendus dans la salle à manger située au demi sous-sol. L’espace était vaste et bruyant, bien que peu fréquenté à ce moment-là. Nous avons commandé deux mojitos, mais avons attendu plus de 15 minutes avant d’être servis.

Enfin, notre chambre donnait sur une arrière-cour où se tenait un mariage, ce qui nous a exposés à la musique forte jusqu’à minuit. Heureusement, le bruit s’est arrêté à ce moment-là, car nous devions nous lever tôt à 4h30 pour visiter le parc Horton Plains.

Globalement, cet hôtel semble privilégier le clinquant au détriment de la qualité et ne mérite pas ses 4 étoiles. C’est l’hôtel le moins satisfaisant parmi les cinq où nous avons séjourné.
title: Mauvaise expérience

roomTip: Do yourself a favor and skip this place
text: I personally hate writing bad reviews, but this place was horrible.  Firstly, I had read a few reviews ahead of time, and it got good reviews, but I also made sure to check online for the menu.  It had several pictures of an extensive menu displayed (roughly 3-4 pages worth including burgers, pizza, etc.) yet when I sat down and asked the waiter for the menu he passed me a tablet with a single page (only 5 or 6 items on the menu).  I tried scrolling thinking there were more, but it would not scroll!  So I decided on the wok rice with chicken and pineapple juice.  The food preparation took a normal amount of time, and the pineapple juice was good, however, the wok rice with chicken was absolutely horrible.  There was next to no taste, and the only spice was the black pepper added to the chicken.  After spending 2 weeks in Sri Lanka and having some amazing food, this was by far the worst meal I had.  But it does not end there... after finishing I moved my plate to the opposite side of the table and waited.  It took about 15 to 20 minutes before the waiter finally realized I was done (and only because his coworker noticed and sent him over).  When it came time to pay (I had checked before eating that card was OK, which I was told it was) the waiter brought my bill over, did not show it, and took my card which he disappeared upstairs for 3-4 minutes and came back with my receipt.  At no point during my meal did the waiter come by and ask how the meal was, or if I wanted anything else.  This place was absolutely disappointing, and I was very upset with the lack of service and quality of the food.  Something else I noticed, I had been eating all across Sri Lanka for the last 2 weeks (including Colombo) and the only charges on my bill were service charge (mostly 10% of the bill), however, this place I noticed added a 'goverment tax' of almost a third of the bill which I had not seen on any other receipt I received over my entire stay in Sri Lanka.  I would not recommend this place.
title: Food and service was horrible, not to mention ridiculous prices  (along with an unknown charge)

placeInfo/address: 16 Park Road, Colombo 00500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Tiny balcony
text:
Unfriendly staff, slightly grubby shabby rooms, and expensive food…
Nice pool. 
On a busy road, so noisy rooms. 
Restaurant was nice, food ok, but then they added 30% ‘tax’ to the food bill!! Never had that before in 2 weeks in Sri Lanka. So a 1600LR poached egg becomes 2150! No mention in the menu. 
A very unfriendly message in the bathroom warning of a USD100 fine for any visible damage to linen or towels… what’s that about? What counts as damage?! Never seen anything like that before. Not welcoming or friendly. 
Cannot recommend sadly. A slightly sad end to an otherwise fantastic 2 week trip to SL.
title: Unfriendly staff, slightly grubby shabby rooms, and expensive food…

placeInfo/address: 16 Park Road, Colombo 00500 Sri Lanka
text:
We arrived after a 25 hours flight at 10 AM.

But if you want a room now you can pay 40 dollars for early check in.
I said I have a 4 day reservation. Can you do the courtesy of allowing us to rest earlier for free? The room is empty anyway.
They said no and the room stayed empty 
VERY BAD CUSTOMER SERVICE
title: Very bad customer service

placeInfo/address: 16 Park Road, Colombo 00500 Sri Lanka
text:
To Whom It May Concern

This is to inform you of a disappointed service & treatment by your ME Colombo staff.

We chose your hotel for this with past personal experience. But, I was shocked.

* Requested place was not given. It was not reserved at all and another team occupied that location at the same time. Your team confirmed to give the place that I requested by sending a photograph of the location
* The given chairs were not comfortable at all. 
* Team was not allowed to get into the lift from the ground floor and asked to go to the 1st floor to use the lift. But, a customer who came in an Audi was allowed (discrimination) 
* Doorman didn't have a smile at all
* None of the roof top waiters were friendly and had frowning faces like my team is a threat and a pain to them
*Tea or Iced Coffee preference was not asked and all were given Iced Coffee (Iced Coffee was not good at all)
*Also, one of our team fallen sick on the same day night

Thoroughly disappointed. Please speak to me if you require further details. 

However, food was PERFECT.
title: Poor Service, Discrimination, but nice food.

placeInfo/address: 16 Park Road, Colombo 00500 Sri Lanka
text:
Had a reservation for the weekend buffet . The amount paid for a person was comparatively lesser than most of places but its not that cheap either. They spend so much on social media marketing and when we try to get some information no one follows up. It has been over months and no response was still received for inquiries.

However, the buffet barely qualifies as a buffet since the varieties and the spread was very little. Even their salad bar exceeds items from thier mains. Most of the items were vegetarian including the soup and you could barely find seafood. Only a fillets of swordfish was available and the seafood noodles had cut up small prawns which is not that much(hard to find the pieces) . Action station was also available but also vegetarian. Their only rice main which is the biriyani is made from "keeri samba" instead of basmathi rice. 

They don't fill up the food trays more often and that tray isn't filled all the way so you have small portions inside those. Desserts were okay and was delicious. Overall the food tastes good and presentation was okay. 

The only perk of the buffet is that they let  you use the pool. The pool has an incredible view and had to give some stars for that.

I would not go for buffet anytime soon there since with an small additional amount you could have a decent buffet minus the pool somewhere else.
title: The Buffet

placeInfo/address: 16 Park Road, Colombo 00500 Sri Lanka
text: Don't Go to Me Colombo Ever you will regret it for sure. There are only few peoples who is helpful and the management sucks. Food was awful only good things they had was the Location & the Live Music. Never Coming back
title: This Shitest Place On Sri Lanka!!

placeInfo/address: 16 Park Road, Colombo 00500 Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: 16 Park Road, Colombo 00500 Sri Lanka
text:
Spend the day package experience was horrible.They served a cold pizza that tasted like cardboard. This pizza was supposed to be a spicy chicken pizza which in reality wasn't even spicy and zero flavor. Service was terrible, may be they were short on staff. Room, lunch and tea for 70usd was the package but do you really have to serve unedited food so that the customer buys more? Don't think so, I cut my stay short (no partial refund) and went to a different restaurant to eat lunch. Thanks for ruining my day.
I would not recommend this place. No value for money. Worst experience I had in Colombo and that says something.
title: Pizza tasted like cardboard

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Gourie,

Greetings from ME Colombo,

We do take customer complaints very seriously and we do respond to them in urgent manner to avoid miscommunications and misunderstandings. As per a hotel which is open for public figures, we do take customer privacy as one of our prime concerns and we do have strict privacy policy at our hotel. We DO NOT disclose guest details to any other 3rd party guests or staff and we are maintaining strict security procedures at he hotel to maintain it. At our premises in the hotel, we do take all precautionary actions to keep the confidentiality of each and every guests. All our areas are covered with surveillance cameras and our security officials are always there in all our hotel areas for the safety and the well being  of the guests. As a policy, our duty managers are always there at the hotel on 24 hours basis to monitor the operations/systems and attend guests requests and complaints. We, as a team, we have a procedures to attend guests complaints and we always attend immediately to them. So we were not aware of this incident and non of our duty managers were informed regarding such incidents if not we would have respond to you in urgent professional manner.

However , we have inquired your incident with our team and we've ensured our policies are in operations as we implemented and our management,security and all our staff members are adhering to all the regulations. We have never encountered such incident in the past and this is the first time we are receiving such a review from a guests as we are always maintain our standard at our hotel with many restrictions.

We thank you for your review and we will take all necessary rules and regulations to tight our security protocols which is already in place.

Yours Sincerely,

Front Office Manager 
ME Colombo

placeInfo/address: 16 Park Road, Colombo 00500 Sri Lanka
text:
The rooftop bar has a fantastic view and the hotel receptionist who was on duty was very hospitable.

I went to the rooftop bar with my four friends on 25th Aug 2020 and we ordered 2 hot chocolates, 1 cappuccino,1 papaya juice, and 2 club sandwiches. drinks arrived after 20 minutes and hot chocolates were cold.sandwiches took 45 minutes to arrive. I informed a couple of times about the delay but no one bothered.

after 45 minutes we received cold and over fried French fries and rubbish sandwiches which were really disappointing from a place located in the heart of the Colombo city.
title: Worst experience in Colombo

placeInfo/address: 16 Park Road, Colombo 00500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: choose a room in another hotel if you enjoy sleep
text:
Our stay was memorable but unfortunately for the wrong reasons.
Firstly front of house staff were very helpful during our stay and a special mention to the gentleman, Mr Lalith, working the bar at the pool.
Our room was good but the floor was not cleaned very well as the soles of our feet were “black” from walking around in bare feet.  
The servicing of the room was lacking due to attention to detail in just some minor areas – we had to ask to have the toilet rolls and coffee replaced on a couple of occasions.
Now the major problems of the hotel.  We were on level 5 and were faced with constant barking of the dog from the penthouse above.  I believe the owner might live there.  Not what residents want to hear as they try to go to sleep.  
The roof top swimming pool – great set up and view of Colombo however here are the problems:-
•	It is a very small area yet day users were in regular attendance not leaving much seating/space for hotel guests.  
•	On one day they were 10+ men basically taking up one half of the pool area and they were also drinking.  No issue with having a drink but two bottles of Bacardi and glasses in the actual swimming pool!!
•	On another day a group of 7 day users taking up too much space and they didn’t have money to pay their bill.  Not fair on the staff.
•	The parties held at night again are not fair to hotel guests trying to get to sleep but the music is quite easily heard on level 5.  When they finally stopped a staff member was dragging the furniture across the tiles which again was quite loud on level 5.  I actually had to get out of bed and go up to the pool area to ask the staff member to lift the furniture rather than dragging the furniture.     
•	The hotel needs to decide are they running a hotel or running a nightclub?  
The building is not sound proof and we would not recommend to anyone if you want a decent nights sleep.
title: Hotel or Nightclub?

placeInfo/address: 16 Park Road, Colombo 00500 Sri Lanka
text: Do not visit this small hotel , this is located in very busy environment and you can hear honking from even inside the room , rooms are awful , need to clean toilets , no parking at all , untrained staff ..
title: Poor customer service

placeInfo/address: Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don’t book this hotel
text:
I have already given a review of this hotel whilst staying there.
The hotel was disappointing due to the fact it was shabby and damp, it needs a lot of attention.
Our room was damp your clothes were always feeling wet, mould growing around toilet and walls felt wet. Management advised us keep the air conditioning on all the time which didn’t help, even your toilet roll was wet.
When booking holiday the hotel was for Englishbreakfast buffet. Only time it was was when the weekend came and the hotel was still not full we had buffet on for the weekend.
Pool area needed attention concrete edges were breaking up.
Stairways were not lit when needed.
The staff were polite and helpful, pools boys were great.
The saving feature of our holiday was our room man who looked after us very well.
Altogether an absolute waste of money, we are a well travelled couple if this had been our first time in Sri Lanka we would have never come back.
title: Disappointed holiday

placeInfo/address: Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Stay 1 night max. Eat at Lord’s if you like a lively place, eat at Prego for quality italian
text:
Poorly trained staff at pool, poolbar, breakfast

Poor breakfast (little choice, staff can’t cook a proper omelette, no fresh bread) and one day they just removed the whole buffet and made us order from a tiny a la carte menu

Low quality room (you get an ancient key, a/c makes huge noise, no black out curtains). Furniture on balcony worthless. Bed okay though. Sound proving not optimal either. 

Pool area makes no sense (staff seem more content to speak to eachother than actually work). When I asked for another parasol they initially told me that our daughters just had to sit somewhere else. Pool shallow. Beach useless, no swimming in the ocean. 

They say they have a gym but it is actually in their sister hotel Jetwing Blue which did have a proper breakfast room and buffet. 

Huge craw problem that steal your food or snacks. Constant noise of craws can be irritating (but same at other negombo hotels). 

Positives
Theresa at the front office

If you need to stay in negombo, stay in jetwing blue. More modern.
title: At best a 3 star and that is generous

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you very much for taking your time to share your review on TripAdvisor, following your most recent stay at Jetwing Beach.
We sincerely apologize for the inconvenience and disappointment you experienced during your visit.
We understand your frustration and we apologize for the misunderstanding regarding the pool usage policy.
Our hotel has been operating as an adults-only property since September 2023 as we have been accommodating the Emirates Airlines cabin crew, and will continue till 30th April 2024. Hence, we do not accommodate guests under 18 years. Also, as a policy, when the hotel is running on high occupancy, we limit accepting non-resident guests to use the swimming pool, provided that the resources such as sun loungers are limited. This is done purely to avoid any inconvenience to both our resident and non-resident guests and is not based on any discriminatory term. However, we understand that these factors should’ve been communicated to you in an appropriate manner.
We strive to provide exceptional service to all our guests, regardless of nationality or background, and it is disheartening to know that we fell short of meeting your expectations on this occasion.
We appreciate your valuable feedback as it helps us to identify areas for improvement and to ensure that all our guests have a positive experience.
Once again, we apologize for the inconvenience caused, and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back in the future and provide you with the excellent service that you deserve.

Ayubowan! (May you live long!)

Ravindra de Silva
Deputy General Manager
Jetwing Beach

text: 1st week of the February we were there used their pool then they did not tell anything but next time I called to ask to use the pool they said its not allowed to use the pool for locals.then I said actually my husband is Swedish and then my son also , n my self who lives in abroad.So how does it apply to us and then he kept me on hold then ask how old 8s my son I said 3 years then he made a fake excuse telling that they don't allow kids what? I asked then I used your pool 4 weeks ago n now say like this.and then he said go to the jetwing blue which locals use.really unprofessional and he kept telling its the management and there rules, now I am wondering what are these rules.how does it apply for my family.i am really disappointed.i felt ashamed to tell this is how my country treats.if they said like some other hotels they don't take outsiders  only take the packages like buffet and pool its okey.or else some hotels informed us telling there's no sunbeds but if you like without its okey.we used so many other hotels like club dolphin, camlot, pledge escape they are really good and know how to treat their guest.but the reasons jetwing beach said to me really different. ownerResponse/text:
Dear guest,

Thank you very much for taking your time to share your feedback based on your experience in making an online reservation at Jetwing Beach.
We are extremely sorry for the inconvenience caused due to the confusion in the rates and the subsequent communication by our reservations team. As you have correctly mentioned in your comments, the room rates were significantly low on the day in question, and this was due to an error by our team who uploads and maintains online rates.
Our actual rate was LKR 33,900 and the rate your booking had picked was LKR 2,301.56 which is a rate Jetwing Beach will never offer even at the best promotional campaign.
Although we spoke to you to explain about this genuine human error in feeding the rates into the system, upon your dissent to pay the normal rate, we accommodated your booking being a responsible organization which places the interests of our guests in the first place.
We trust that you did enjoy the stay and our hospitality, and hope you would continue to patronize Jetwing Beach despite this experience.

Ayubowan! (May you live long!)

Ravindra de Silva
Deputy General Manager
Jetwing Beach
placeInfo/address: Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
Room rates were significantly lower on both Jetwing website and Booking.com for the dates I picked. So, I thought they are having a big promotion or discount for these days, and I made a booking directly, paid the 100% total amount(including taxes) displayed at that time using my credit card and got the confirmation email. Pretty usual right? After several hours I got an email from the Jetwing reservation team saying the rates were lower because of a system glitch and now I have to pay more than what I agreed to. 

It did not look like a glitch to me as I refreshed the website multiple times to be sure the rates are correct. As any other customer I'd expect Jetwing Beach to honor my reservation which was already confirmed and paid in full. But the reservation team insisted that I pay the "new" rate. This behavior from a 5-star hotel is unacceptable and utterly disappointing. I would avoid this hotel next time as I don't want to be scammed again.
title: Reservation Nightmare

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback on TripAdvisor after your recent stay at Jetwing Beach. We genuinely appreciate your valuable input.
We sincerely apologize for any confusion caused by the tax calculations. It seems that we were unable to effectively communicate how the taxes were calculated during your visit. Please allow us to clarify: in accordance with government regulations, all purchases made at the hotel are subject to a 10% service charge, 2.5% Social Security Contribution Levy, and 15% Value Added Tax (VAT). VAT is applied on top of the service charge and the Social Security Levy.
We have made an effort to mention this in all our menus in a clear and concise manner, however we will also ensure that our associates are re-trained to properly communicate to this our guests, to avoid any confusion in the future. 
Despite the issue regarding the tax calculation, we hope your vacation has been a pleasant one and that you had an amazing time visiting Sri Lanka. We are grateful for your understanding and would like to assure you that your feedback will be taken seriously and used to enhance the guest experience.
We thank you once again and we hope this experience will not deter you from providing us with a second chance to restore your lost confidence with a better and improved stay in the future. 

Ayubowan! (May you live long!)

Ravindra de Silva
Hotel Manager
Jetwing Blue and Jetwing Beach
placeInfo/address: Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
Be ready to pay a hidden TRIPLE tax at the restaurant of up to 30% of your meal cost. Nobody was able to give proper or clear explanations of why it's hidden or so high. 
Most of taxes are hidden everywhere in this country and kept in secret. 
A kind warning to all the tourist to stay alert and not get cheated.
title: Beware of hidden taxes

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for taking your time to post your constructive feedback on TripAdvisor, following your recent stay with us.
First and foremost, please accept our sincere apologies for the inconvenience you had experienced with the pool attendant which we have personally investigated and ensured that this kind of behavior will not be repeated in the future.
The interruptions caused by the beach vendors has our full attention and although not part of the hotel team, rest assured that we are taking some measures to address the situation while respecting their needs to make a living.
Further we have taken a serious note of the areas that need immediate attention for rectifications.
We thank you for bringing these to our attention thereby helping us to fix our shortcomings and attaining solutions to better ourselves in future. 
However, we are especially humbled by your complements on the quality and taste of the food plated by our seasoned chefs at Grill Street as well as our associates.  
Once again, we deeply regret the inconveniences caused and hope that this won’t deter you from visiting us again as we look forward to the opportunity of welcoming you once again in the future for a more comfortable and relaxing stay. 

Ayubowan! (May you live long!)

Ravindra de Silva
Hotel Manager
Jetwing Blue and Jetwing Beach
placeInfo/address: Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If you are staying Friday - Sunday then visit the street food place over the road
text:
There are a few things I did like about this hotel. For the most part the staff were very nice, there were excellent cocktails which are reasonably priced (although beware prices don’t include tax unlike most places so they seem cheaper than they are) and the room was clean and comfortable. Also on the weekend they do a street food thing across from the hotel where the food is really authentic (read ferociously spicy), super tasty and cheap. 
Overall though I was not a fan. We stayed for 1 night at the end of our trip. Firstly I just didn’t like the area, I wish we had gone back to Colombo. The beach is fine but full of hawkers and mosquitoes. 
The biggest thing that put me off was my experience by the pool. My husband was going to the gym (which is in the other hotel) so I went to sit by the pool. As others have mentioned none of the loungers are actually on hotel property, all on the beach and although there are palm trees they do not provide full shade. Getting towels I had to speak to the attendant who gave me the 3rd degree on who I was, if I was a stewardess, where my friends were etc, not in an accusatory way, just really creepy. The towels themselves were gross by the way, totally threadbare and filthy. So already uncomfortable I went to sit down (with the attendant still hovering trying to talk to me) and realised a hawker was already making her way towards me trying to engage. I felt so uncomfortable on my own I just packed pack up and left and hid in the room until my husband came back. 
At breakfast they were doing the set menu thing which I find very odd as surely there is more waste that way as people have to order more to get the selection they want. They did give us the option to go next door to the jetwing blue buffet which we did, but again you have to run the gauntlet of hawkers. 
Overall as I said I would much rather have been back in Colombo. The 30 min transfer time you save is not worth staying in the hotel or area in my opinion.
title: Hit and miss

Jetwing Blue and Jetwing Beach
placeInfo/address: Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed one night in this hotel before our flight back home. We were tempted by the nice reviews  and photos of the pool and the beach.

The reality was grim - the hotel could be 3 sta le at best - it is extremely rundown. The rooms are gloomy, dark, damp
And horribly old. The beach is a no better place to be - old and broken deck chairs and stained cushions. Stray dogs and crows add to the ambience. Sellers are constantly trying to sell products at the beach. 

The restaurant and the food offered at the beach are average - the chairs and tables are so old and badly maintained that the whole place make u only happier when it comes time to leave.

And all that for 140 dollars per night without breakfast - this is one of the worst hotels I have been to - AVOID!!!!
title: Horrible - AVOID

ownerResponse/text:

Thank you for sharing your experience at Jetwing Beach on TripAdvisor.
We sincerely apologize that we were not able to meet up to your expectations. While we are pleased to hear that you found our associates to be friendly and hospitable, your experience with the accommodation, food and beach are noted with due attention. We assure you that we would take immediate measures to improve on the areas you have mentioned to provide a better experience for all our guests.

Jetwing Beach
placeInfo/address: Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
Seeing the beautiful pictures and reading all the positive reviews I was really not expecting what this hotel turned out to be - a big disappointment. I'm guessing the other guests leaving positive reviews only stayed overnight as they were transferring to/from the airport. This was my fourth Jetwing and fifth overall hotel during my Sri Lanka trip and could not even compare to some of the other 4 and 5 star places I've stayed at. It is the only hotel receiving a negative review.

The room was really worn down, with a lot of the furniture and appliances needing urgent replacing. Air conditioning was old and moody. Some of the wall mounted appliances were coming off, others just didn't work at all. The sound proofing was very poor, if you happened to have any neighbours next door you could easily hear all their conversations, same for any traffic down the corridor...

Hotel restaurant was average, food selection was ok, however on the first two nights there was a set menu instead of buffet and some of my courses arrived cold. I was advised guests staying at the Jetwing Beach could use all the amenities of Jetwing Blue, yet the one day I tried I was told it was impossible to even get a drink from the bar unless I'll pay in cash (no card accepted).

The beach is very long and wide, but completely overrun by hawkers who kept staring and nagging hotel guests all day long. Due to the proximity to the port it was also quite dirty... 

I really love animals but the amount of stray dogs that were practically residing in the restaurant was a bit too much even for me. Same goes for the number of ravens/crows that were all over the place and stealing food whenever you left it unattended forever a split second.

The only really good thing about this hotel was the staff - great, kind and friendly people who made my 3 day stay bearable.
title: Disappointing hotel

ownerResponse/text:

placeInfo/address: Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
For the money you pay this hotel is definitely not worth it. Everytime you go to eat in the restraunt there are dogs there making it uncomfortable to enjoy your food. We asked for a sea view but wasn't clearly visible from our room. The hotel seems outdated and it wasn't as good as RIU where we previously spent the past few nights. Breakfast was good with decent options. I wouldn't pay $244 to stay somewhere like here and would recommend elsewhere. Disappointed that i told them i was coming for honeymoon and nothing was done, not even bed decoration which even guesthomes have done. The beach is crowded with local people, dinner varirty was poor.

Really hoped that this hotel would be the best but even the guesthomes i stayed in were better.
title: Wouldn't recommend

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for sharing your insightful feedback following your recent stay at Jetwing Beach.

We are sorry that we failed to meet your expectations in certain areas and will certainly treat them as an opportunity to make improvements. We are happy that you also had some pleasant experiences during your stay.

We hope that we will get another opportunity to serve you better upon your next visit to Sri Lanka.

Ayubowan! (May you live long!)

Ravindra De Silva,

Resident Manager
placeInfo/address: Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Avoid the hotel
text:
I’m not really sure why this is rated so highly. Our 3 night stay did not live up to what this hotel is promoted to be. 

Firstly I would like to note the good things: welcome on reception.
Room was kept well clean (this is despite a minor issue on day 1 but when we raised it housekeeping were terribly apologetic and kept the room spotless thereafter) 
Because the occupancy was low we got an A-La carte menu instead of Buffett at dinner, on 2 nights and the food was very good. 
We had a very good experience in the spa. 
The drinks are reasonably priced. 

Despite the above we would not recommend staying here.

COVID measures are not followed.  Many staff do not wear the mask properly. At the Buffett there were no gloves and minimum sanitising stations. 

The service in the restaurant was slow, the staff are not very observant / attentive and it seems that only the manager knows how to open a bottle of wine.

The Buffett was not properly prepared e.g. forks were provided instead of tongues for fruit , cake , salad dishes which made it very awkward to pick up the food and as a result there was food spilled on floor and I did witness guests using their hands to pick up food which was very unhygienic.  On our first experience of evening Buffett, it was 7.20 PM before it was ready despite the restaurant opening at 7.00 PM.  

The pictures are misleading.The pool area is actually overlooking a public beach. And all the sun loungers are on that public beach. You therefore end up with all the local beach sellers coming up to you constantly throughout the day trying to sell to you. It is really uncomfortable and not at all relaxing everyone therefore tries to take a sun lounger in the back row which is closest to the hotel. There are also lots of stray dogs wondering around and many times they would end up under your sun lounger or next to you in the restaurant.

There are 5 umbrellas and only 4 are working. If you get there late and all the umbrellas are taken, you need to sit under the palm trees for shade and be close to all the local beach sellers who will sit and stare at you. This is very uncomfortable and I don’t think it helps that the pool attendants/ lifeguards seem to know them and will stand there chatting with them for a long time (usually with mask down) 

There are 3 side tables available only, so again If you are late and don’t get one you have to hold your drink or risk putting it on the sand  next to a stray dog.

The staff are generally friendly but there is a lack of attention to detail and attentiveness. E.g. they will serve food and drinks on the beach but will not come back to take away the plates / cups when you finished unless they are returning from serving some one else. That famous Sri-Lankan hospitality is lacking, it did seem that some of the staff were overstretched in some areas and over staffed in others and there was a general lack of motivation. 

This place is really on suited to being an a one night stop over to / from the airport. 

When we booked it (via emirates) it was promoted as luxury destination and good end to our honeymoon trip around Sri-Lanka but  unfortunately it really did not live up to the same standards as other hotels we visited during our honeymoon.
title: Would not return or recommend for more than one night

Read the reviews here and can’t believe the high scores it has acquired. Maybe we visited at the wrong time time then!?! I generally don’t bother to do reviews but felt I had to make an acceptation with this one. 
This is my review for the hotel in low season:
 Rooms were VERY basic and dated in furniture, decor. 
Also...why make the rooms so dark with poor lighting...just don’t get that!!
The pool very poor; one was overly chlorinated (3 days we where there I could see used wrappers left floating around the pool) whilst the children’s pool very poor state. All three children playing there had cuts on their feet to poor standard of tiles and general pool maintenance.(tiles coming away from the floor of pool, side of pool...even the concrete supports weathered away and crumbling. Complained to management about this...it only took until we checked out and literally loading suitcases onto the bus for management to acknowledge  my complaint and talk to me mumbling a pathetic excuse about “...only just being told”
Restaurant had wild local stray dogs freely running through with ...restaurant staff just standing by looking on! Restaurant staff VERY slow to deal with customer requests even for a simple glass of water...waited 20 minutes before getting it myself from back of the restaurant. Restaurant staff really looked as if they couldn’t be bothered and didn’t want to be there. 
Generally very poor hotel and disappointing stay.
title: Disappointing stay, woeful rooms, pool and facilities, restaurant staff were very poor and very lacking in hospitality

General Manager
placeInfo/address: Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Bring roach spray
text:
When we arrived in our room, I immediately found a large, dead cockroach being eaten by ants in the bathroom. That night, while using the toilet, I reach for toilet paper and nearly touched another 2-inch-long cockroach, this one alive and crawling right next to me on the wall. I called the front desk who sent a couple guys to douse my bathroom in pesticide and kill the roach. The very next night - yet again - when I got up to go to the bathroom in the night, I found a live roach crawling on the shower mat. It ran into a hole in the wall. That's three giant cockroaches in the span of two days. I hate cockroaches and knowing that my room - and thus the entire hotel - was crawling with them made me jumpy, paranoid and highly uncomfortable throughout my stay. I realize that roaches live in tropical places like Sri Lanka, but this is the only hotel during my two week stay that I encountered this issue. In addition to the roaches, the property itself needs a complete makeover. The door in our bathroom was detached, for example, and the AC was not functioning properly. 

The hotel staff are extremely friendly and helpful, but unfortunately that wasn't enough to make up for the roaches and general disrepair of the property.
title: Roach Motel

placeInfo/address: Porutota Road, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
Fortunately we only stayed here for one night due to its close proximity to the airport before taking our return flight home.  

This is definitely not the same standard or category as the other Jetwing hotels we were fortunate to have stayed at namely Vil Uyana and Yala. 
 
. The sun loungers were broken with torn and worn mattresses.

. The beach was strewn with joint butts, plastic bottles and drink cans and nothing like the glorious, clean beaches we had left behind in Bentota.

. The swimming pool was dirty with rust spots on every tile and generally not enticing. 

. Beach vendors selling their goods were intrusive.

. The rooms were large, clean but tired.

. The staff were indifferent and certainly not as friendly or welcoming as other staff we had encountered on the rest of our 15 day tour of Sri Lanka.

.  At lunchtime we witnessed a chef at The Deck place king prawns on skewers without wearing gloves and then handling cheese and salad without washing his hands.   We were nervous about eating anything there due to the lack of basic food hygiene and heaven help anyone with a seafood allergy.  We then went to the main restaurant and ordered a cheese sandwich from the main kitchen! 

For this reason we were not taking any chances and decided to eat dinner (a la carte) at Jetwing Blue just next door.  A completely different property and synonymous with what we would expect and had experienced of the Jetwing brand.

We did eat breakfast which was buffet style but chose to eat a freshly cooked omelette at the egg station by a chef wearing gloves!!
title: Not for us!!

text:
We arrived this place late in the evening, only wanted to take a shower and go to sleep. The room was full with spiders, insects and mosquitoes everywhere, ceiling, on the bed, in the toilet, sink. After going down to the reception complaining, a man came to our room to kill the spiders with a broom and spray. He put so much spray we couldn’t breath in the room (also couldn’t open the window so more mosquitoes wouldn’t come inside the room). We didn’t see any point to move to another room, because all the rooms are the same. Plus, A/C is super noisy and Wi-Fi is not working properly. Breakfast is mediocre. After all of this, the “hotel” manager expected us to pay the full rate, even after explaining what happened. I am definitely not recommend this place, think twice before going there. 
Attached some photos *after* the man came up to kill the insects.
title: A bad experience

AYUBOWAN...
Dear Sir,
Thank you for your comments. I apologize for the problems that you encountered during your last stay. This is not the type of review that we like to see, and I assure you that I will be looking into each point that you have made. I would like to inform you that these difficulties happened due to bad weather. Extremely very sorry for the inconvenience what was happened during your stay.

placeInfo/address: 831 1/3, Pelwehera Road, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
Let me start by saying the staff and manager were amazing and really really tried to help us.. which is why I have atleast rated this place 2 out of 5...  instead of just 0.

1) No HOT WATER AT ALL - One our 1st morning we "gently" notified them of the problem.. things break.. it happens.. I am reasonable.  When we returned at the end of the day.. we were told it was fixed.. it was NOT... we were occupying half their hotel.. and were extremely unhappy after the long flights previous day and full day of tours.. and no ability to relax and shower... We were.. pissed.... and we had to call the owner ... who admitted they are 'trying to find a technician to fix it"  Really? Very poor for a hotel of such standard during the HIGH SEASON.  

The Manager arranged for us to shower at another hotel 20 minutes away - was NOT ideal for a large family... though I appreciated this offer and only a couple of us took up this .. 

2) WATER LEAKAGE from the ceiling and bathroom wall into our room (Number 1) -  - there was water filled up on part of the floor after overnight rains.   I am not talking about a small annoying 'drip drip' once every few minutes... part of the floor had large puddles... like someone took 2 coffee mugs filled with water and spilled it...  LUCKILY our bag was not under the leak or in the puddle.  I'm not sure what I would have done if it had all gotten wet... 

3) No working wifi .. it was 'barely' working.. it wasn't the end of the world and I realize I am in a Developing nation.. but in today's day and age, you come to depend on using Wifi for many basic things.. and the hotel says it provides 'wifi'!   

Again the Manager showed us their 3 wifi routers.. but which were only working 'every now and then. .... and only  if you sat in the lobby.

Thanks again to the Staff for understanding and admitting they were sorry to have ruined our vacation.  The Manager tried to make up by packing us lunch on our last day and was super nice... and we said we know it's not 'their fault' .. but it IS the Manager's responsibility to work with the Owner have #1-2 fixed ASAP.  That's just plain unacceptable.

Unrelated - the distance from the main road to the hotel is 2 Km (1.3 miles)..and about half is a 'dirt road'.. so not an easy or fun walk esp if it rains.. .  So don't expect to take a walk or stroll  after dinner to some nearby shops or be able to catch a tuk tuk or taxi.. You Better have a car here.
title: Sorry to give such a low rating.. but here are 3 solid reasons why

text:
Disclaimer: Since I opted for the highest room category, I think my expectations might be a bit high, but if anyone is thinking about booking the "Themed Suite with Plunge Pool", Don't!

Overall 3/10 
I will actively tell people not to go; it was a waste of a perfectly good weekend.

Room quality 3/10 
From mouldy ceilings above the bed to algae or moss on the side of the plunge pool to dirty-looking bathtub nozzles, water jets or whatever you call them things, they truly hit the mark of a six-figure room stay.

Service 5/10 
All in all, a few of the staff were attentive, but from the check-in and check-out experiences to "room service not listening to what was asked" and "housekeeping doing loud repairs on a Sunday morning behind my room," while they were moving the lawn mower below my balcony, it was just a disaster.

Food 5/10
It wasn't bad, apart from the cold BBQ and the not-so-great coffee, we wouldn't complain. But nothing good, nothing to make you feel special or excited.

The long story

I called and made a reservation around 6 p.m. on a Saturday for one of their "Themed Suites with Plunge Pool," which is supposed to be the most expensive room category, boasting about royalty. 

I called and mentioned that I would like to check in about 45 minutes on a half-board basis. I gave my name and number to confirm the reservation.

What I expected-  to get down, give my keys to the valle and mention that I'm checking-in, walk to the reception, get greeted warmly, ask me about  anything .... (why I made the reservation this late, where I'm coming from, make conversation) tell me a little bit about the hotel, the story, serve a welcome drink and get my paperwork done while I enjoy the view/ drink/ architecture etc. for them to be ready and get me set with a room (including my bags being brought to it) quickly so I can get settled.

Or better yet, get asked about why I'm making the booking so late on the call itself, update me on the check-in procedure, ask if I'm driving, advise me on the easiest/ most convenient parking (reserve a parking spot) and get the paperwork ready for me to sign when I get in, so I can pay and get to the room.

What happened- 
My wife pulls our little car up to the entrance. We mentioned our name, and we are checking in. We get down, and they start unloading the bags. Then, we get told there is no valet service and that we need to find a parking spot, which might be on the other side of the road. (luckily, this did not happen, as one of the staff realized how unhappy we were and said we could park just a few meters from the entrance)

We go to the check-in counter, and one of the staff mentions that they are the person who answered my call and we have to check in on the 1st floor and proceed to take us up the elevator (no special greeting, just hi sir, let me take you upstairs)

We go up to the 1st floor, and I give them my credit card and ID card ... 10 minutes later, someone comes with a welcome drink trolly with a king coconut, pineapple and some other fruit as decoration (yes, instantly while looking at it when I asked for a king coconut, he mentioned this was only for decoration and they had ambarella and some other fruit juices), and I was utterly disappointed about the false adverting on the trolly and opted to have water insted of their options. 

Fast-forward 10 more minutes. The front office person to whom I gave my cards returned a form that I had to fill out and sign so I could pay. Finally, about 30 minutes later, we are taken to the room, given a small intro on where the kitchen, jacuzzi bath, and plunge pool are, and left to relax. When we asked about the bags, they took another 15 minutes to arrive. 

They had a special BBQ for dinner: chicken, pork, beef and seafood. While most of the meat was cold, a queue of people at the seafood stall waited for prawns. (yes I understand when the meat is left out for a while, they goes cold, but when you have staff at each of the stations dwindling their thumbs, the least they can do is ask the guest if they want it reheated or made fresh) 

While the restaurant was relatively busy during dinner service, I did not notice any urgency overall. I had to hold my hand up for a few minutes at a time, looking to get someone's attention so I could ask for a couple of wine glasses, a fresh fork (yes, the cutlery that I left on the side plate was taken along with the other plate), or a toothpick. 

When I returned to the room, I called room service and asked for an ice bucket (I did mention that I wanted to use it to chill a bottle of wine) and  I got a bucket with less than half the ice and by itself, no cloth, plate, or stand.  

The following morning, we had a huge puddle of sweat on the coffee table from the ice bucket, so we chose to go to the balcony for our morning coffee. Once on the balcony, it felt like my old place in Melbourne, with my annoying neighbour doing the lawnmowing every Sunday morning. (yes, when I looked, we had the lawnmower going right under us) 

It gets even better when we return to the room; we hear a constant loud banging from behind and later find out that some construction is going on behind the room. 

I won't say much about breakfast. It was neither excellent nor horrible. I had adjusted my expectations at this points, mainly after dinner, lawnmowing and construction morning, but the icing on the cake was the bathtub/jacuzzi and the plunge pool that we did not feel was hygienic to get in.

I mean, with all of the inlets/ outlets looking brown and marks/ spots on other areas, this looked like the amenities at Galleface Hotel before the renovation (the kind you don't want to use.. We also had lime/ green stuff around the plunge pool, mold kind of black spots on the ceiling over the bed and even managed to have a horrible check out experience. 

So either I expect too much, or somebody has lost the ball here.
title: How Jetwing ruined a perfectly good weekend

text:
Got to the hotel at 5 pm on 31st night. We were part of a large group, most of which had already checked in. Myself and friend staying in another room were welcomed and asked to wait as they arrange. After about 1.5 frustrating hours of being bitten by mosquitoes my friend finally got her room (with wine glasses that had lipstick stains on them mind you). We were kept waiting, and finally after 2 hours I told them that we are going to go wait in a friends room to send the keys there. Another 30 elapsed and still nothing, it was 7.30 now and we were expected at function by 8 pm hence this was very frustrating. I stormed towards the reception (they saw me coming and seemed ammused by how angry I was) and demanded to know what was going on... one guy finally told me that they are overbooked by 1 room and will be glad to upgrade us to a suite at their nearby hotel. (one which did not even AC rooms) It was almost comical at this point, I had to sit them down and conduct a Hospitality 101 class to teach them that you dont and cant move a room booked under a group. I said if they had no other choice they will have to offer me a car with a driver for the entire night so I can travel up and down, to which they just looked at me with blank faces not knowing how to respond. Finally after indicating to them that I am going to call the owners of the property if they did not sort out my room within 15 mins, we were given a room which was suppose to be a suite but was not much nicer than the standard room my friends were in. 

This experience pretty much ruined our mood for NYE.
title: Tried to move us to another hotel

placeInfo/address: 433 A Dadella, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Visited Jetwing Lighthouse for our anniversary fpr two nights having great expectations. However, surprisingly they failed to impress us. 

The check-in was fast and the room was lovely. A balcony with a great sea view was a pleasant addition to the room. They had the room decorated and sent us a complimentary cake which was a nice touch.

However, the food was horrendous. Since the crowd was very less, food was served on a set menu basis understandably. But the portions were tiny and not filling at all. The waiters simply said we can't request more food or order anything from the ala carte menu. Further to that, the choice of food in the set menus were very limited. However during the third meal, we complained to the manager Mr. Nishantha (was very helpful) and he arranged a few additional portions. One would expect to be able to order a decent amount of food if the hotel doesn't offer a buffet. 

On the last day they allowed us to order from their ala carte menu. We ordered two pizzas which were over burnt and tasteless. Only the breakfast was good and upto standard.

At around 12 noon on our last day, the front office called us and requested us to vacate the room by 12 noon. I can understand this request if the hotel was fully packed and had a crowd waiting  to check in. But  I'm sure there wasn't more than 5 rooms occupied that day. This was a utter joke, specially from a reputed chain like Jetwing!

Overall it was a very poor experience and will have doubts to visit this hotel again! I hope the staff and management learns how to treat their customers from their sister hotel, Jetwing Lake.
title: Horrible! Don't know what the hype is all about!

It saddens us greatly to know that you will not visit us again, but we genuinely hope you will give us another chance to show you the true hospitality of Jetwing Lighthouse.

Ayubowan! (May you live longer)

PRIYANTHIKA WIJENAIKE
General Manager
Jetwing Lighthouse
placeInfo/address: 433 A Dadella, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
The only positive was the room. It was pretty spacious and had enough amenities. However, the rest was so poor.

Starting with the restaurant, they had no buffet. Only offered ala cart for all 2 meals (Dinner & Breakfast) we had. Had to choose from a limited menu. Adding further to our disappointment, they took too much time in-between the dishes, although we decided everything (starters, mains, desserts) at one go for them.

The breakfast had more options although it was ala cart. However, again the disappointing delay. Some of the food we ordered never came and we too forgot about it. However, the restaurant should have been more attentive to bring all ordered food to their guests or should have left the menu card with the guests (or are they expecting us to remember everything we order??).

Then comes the Spa. On our seconds day, said the spa was closed for men because they had no staff.

Further, during our dinner, the restaurant manager came in to ask how was the food. Our response was 'fairly ok'. That's it! he never asked why? or what can we do to improve? Nothing!!

The same happened during checkout when they asked how was the stay, we said 'it's alright other than food'. Again, the end of the conversation. Never bothered to ask why.

We do understand the hotel was short-staffed due to a lack of guests in these difficult times (COVID19) but they should have informed us what to expect when the reservation was made.

Overall, utterly disappointed and not worth going again.
title: Not worth it!

placeInfo/address: Mahagastota Hill Climb Blackpool, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: The hotel had several issues. Bad smell in the toilets, terrible smell from the kitchen all over the place and the food was well below average in terms of quality. On the other hand hotel staff was polite and willing to help. I am sure there are better places in the area.

roomTip: Check what you can and can't do with with any amenties/toiletries in your room.
text:
My original review was 5 stars, I have now reduced my rating due to the following treatment by management. On checkout we had to wait whilst our room was checked. No problems for us with that. We were then asked if we had the body lotion, approx 20-30ml little bottle from the bathroom guest toiletries. We were asked to return it, which embarrassed us greatly in the front foyer of the hotel. They made us feel like thieves. Every single hotel we have stayed in throughout many countries, the guest mini toiletries are complimentry for guests to use and take. If there had been a sign in the bathroom regarding leaving excess toiletries, we may have found it unusual and different from every other hotel, but it wouldn't have been a problem.
I suggest management do this re signage, to avoid embarrassment of future guests.
Keep in mind this is supposed to be an upmarket hotel, not a budget hotel. We spent a lot of money with them.
So our issue is not with the general hotel or staff, but the management. What could have been a fantastic memory of this hotel has been soured.

Please see below my initial review, as I stand by my assessment of the general staff and Spa;
Beautiful hotel, with heritage feel.
Comfortable and clean rooms, comfy bed. All general staff members, from front desk, restaurant, bar etc.. very friendly and helpful. And, Praveen, Vimukthi and Chamidu looked after us well.
The Blackpool Hotel Laama Spa (managed by Sam and Sia) was wonderful! Ethan and Sia gave us a very relaxing and reviving Javanese style massage, which was perfect after doing the Worlds End walk . Really worth having one of their spa/massage treatments whilst you are staying here. Reasonably priced for a quality and professional treatment.
The chefs provided delicious food, from set menus through to buffet.
title: Very disappointing after initial promising start😥

placeInfo/address: Mahagastota Hill Climb Blackpool, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
My wife and I stayed for 3 nights in this hotel. The staff and food were generally quite good, and we had a relaxing massage in the Laama spa after a hard trek in the Horton park World's End. However, the bathroom condiments are not complimentary, you can use the contents of the bottle of body lotion but you cannot take the bottle (as you can in every other hotel we've stayed in ), which would have been nice to know from the start. 
On checking out we had to wait for a room check and were told that a body lotion bottle (50ml) was missing and we were told there would be a charge for it. We were forced to search through our luggage and return the bottle of body lotion in the lobby. 
Don't stay here they are ignorant cheapskates.
title: Blackpool hotel does not know how to treat guests properly.

placeInfo/address: Mahagastota Hill Climb Blackpool, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
The hotel looks amazing but is in a poor location too far from the town and not walkable. 
The staff were very friendly and very willing to help but we felt they lacked experience and authority to act on their own. 
The room was brilliant but was in block 3 so was outside the WIFI range.  When we arrived the room had no security safe and the room fridge was on but broken. A security box and replacement fridge was delivered but the second fridge also did not work and whilst we had a security box it kind of defeats the object if you can pick it up and walk away. 
The tv worked but had a poor picture but did have an English film channel. 

The food was very good and there was a great selection one night then a fixed menu the second night.  The bar was good but a little on the pricy side for Sri Lanka. Wine was silly prices after tax the cheapest bottle was around £40.. we bought good wine locally for £8 if the prices were more reasonable we would have bought from the hotel. 

We had a petty issue with water which soured our visit. We had put empty bottles outside the room the previous evening and they were removed rather than replaced then we could not get more free replacement water as reception suggested we had kept the empty glass bottles…. ??? 
They tried to charge us for the replacement water but we argued it away and were given replacement water free of charge in the end.  

TBH we stayed in some amazing hotels but this was not one of them. The money money attitude was poor, WIFi unavailable in the room and the location were poor. 

Staff were lovely but nieve in they duties. 
Food was great but we would not return given a choice.
title: Nice food, lovely staff, poor location, attitude and no room WIFI.

roomTip: If you eat at the restaurant make sure you check your bill, and question it if it does not look alright.
text: I had my tour select this hotel, and when I arrived the receptionist at the desk was extremely friendly, and I kind.  As I was checking in I asked for a quiet room, and was told that the room that I was being given was both quiet ,and grand.  Once I got to the room I noticed a few flies, and was not happy.  I decided to go to the restaurant , the waiter who took my order  barely spoke English, and then when I asked about getting a Bailey Irish creme hot chocolate drink , he told me that was not available.  The manager made me one which I was grateful for.  Then when I asked for the bill, it took the waiter about a good 25 minutes to procure it.  There were three bills , and all three were taxed.  One bill had my food and beer, the second one had the Baileys Chocolate drink, and the third had two extra shots of Baileys.  Then I returned to my room , and got ready for bed, and throughout the night I heard hotel staff going up and the down the hallway as well as having a conversation, and  I was told that hotel had only 15% occupancy.
title: Never again

roomTip: garden rooms are shared with other people so keep your curtains closed when getting ready
text:
We stayed here for two nights 30/03 - 01/04/2018. Upon check-in, we got welcome drinks a hot chocolate which was one of the best. I booked a deluxe room with a bathtub as we have a little girl and mountain views when we got shown our room our views were of local housing and our bathroom never had a shower. When I asked the manager he advised that this is their deluxe rooms and they do not have a bathtub, I was disappointed and felt cheated as they lied, but just got on with it. 

Once we unpacked we thought we'll freshen up, have a quick shower and go down to have dinner. The shower only produced hot water for 3 minutes and we were advised we need to wait 30-45min for hot water again. This made me angry and I asked for a change, I asked for an upgrade and they showed me a smaller room and the male manager was trying to convince me that this is a better room. I declined and then he goes we are fully booked. 

At night we switched the TV on and all the channels were fuzzy, lastly the safe was broken too. Most of this only got sorted on our last day. When I asked if they could do something as I never got the room I promised they refused and hid behind the fact that I booked with 3rd party.

We stayed in a guest house that had better facilities than this. 

PROS - welcome hot chocolate, clean room, quite

CONS - male staff unhelpful, facilities are poor, breakfast average, not worth the money  

I would not recommend this hotel for a family.
title: Not suitable for families

text:
During our 2 week long trip around SriLanka we stayed at The Blackpool hotel for one night. Right up till the end of our stay, the experience was great. The rooms were clean and dinner was nice. Breakfast was arranged for us to take when going to World's End also. HOWEVER at the very end of our trip, after we had all gotten into the van, the manager ran out to our van saying we needed to pay for a dirty towel that they had found in our room. The entire management was in the lobby, demanding we pay 800rupees for this towel which we HAD NOT USED. When the cleaning staff that allegedly found the towel came, we asked him where he had found it. He had no answers. We, very politely told them we had not used it and were not going to pay. They told security to close the gates so we could not leave. Unfortunately we had to catch the train to Ella, so had to pay and leave as we were getting late. 
This was the absolute worst customer service of a hotel and management that we saw during our time in SriLanka. This was a scam, either by the hotel management or cleaning staff. Would not recommend this hotel unless you want to get ripped of!
title: Horrendous customer service!

text:
The room was spacious and clean and hotel has quite a nice view. Huge breakfast buffet so you are bound to find something you like. The general manager made sure to introduce himself and check that we were well taken care of. But what came after our stay was both SHOCKING and UNACCEPTABLE.

We were absolutely shocked to find out the hotel sent 2 people to track us down in our next destination. We woke up in the morning in our new hotel and were about to enjoy our breakfast only to be told by the receptionist that 2 casually dressed men on motor bikes were waiting for us outside and wanted to speak to us (they called our driver to ask about our location without giving him reasons). It turns out the Blackpool Hotel had a mix-up and assumed we left the hotel the day before without checking out and settling the bill. We showed the 2 men the invoice and payment confirmation and they just left! I am still confused and angry at how a reputable hotel, which supposedly won a hotel of the year award, could do such a thing. If the hotel believed we did not pay then they could request their payment through booking.com which has our credit card, not send 2 people on a 4 hour journey!!! Needless to say, we are yet to receive an apology from the hotel.
title: Shocking customer service ruins stay, will never return

The markings are very clearly recorded in the swimming pool and we are surprised that you missed it.
We wish to inform you that you opted to leave on your own volition. The Blackpool Hotel has won Culinary awards and the most coveted World Luxury Awards. Winning these awards are no cakewalk.  Close scrutiny of guest satisfaction survey, standard of food, levels of service, comfort etc., are few of the yardsticks they bank on.

The First aid is a basic necessity of any Hotel of repute and we wish to inform you that at The Blackpool Hotel it is maintained departmentally. 
Many a guest do ask about places of interest, dining out and our Team members are proficient and has the knowledge to answer appropriately. These questions are regularly posed by guests and it is really surprising if they do not answer the queries.
We understand that there were no arguments displeasure shown by guests during your brief stay in the lobby.
