SRI LANKA
placeInfo/address: Mahagastota Hill Climb Blackpool, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
This is the second time I am writing this review. I dnt know understand why TA removed my previous one. 

I am a great believer of the TA community. It has never failed in leading us to some fabulous hotels. So I am still scratching my head on how this hotel could be on top. 

This is definitely not luxury. The bed was small (not even queen) and my husband’s toes were sticking out - he is 5’10”. The food during breakfast was average and dinner was terrible. There was limited options for vegetarians and even that was too spicy for the kids. The F&B manager was unable to fix this.

And most bizarre- the hotel asked us (with two small toddlers) to impromptu leave the hotel on Christmas Eve (though we had booked for 3 nights!), because the owner/CEO apparently didn’t like my husband’s questions!! This was to inquire if there was a shallow end for our 5 year old daughter and pool timings (we were using it at 645pm and as per the rules it’s open till 9pm). He said this was not the time to use the pool!! He also claimed it was international standards, but there was no shallow end or Kids pool, safety jackets or markings for depth! This apparently is the only pool in Nuwara Eliya. The hotel follows none of the required safety protocol. The way the owner was arguing about it needlessly over something which clearly was lacking felt very unnecessary. We must have really affected his ego because we had the manger at our door within half an hour telling us to leave.

And mind you, he threw us out not for creating a scene, being rude or damaging property or picking a fight! Just for asking questions!?! Who does that, and that too on Christmas Eve with 2 toddlers in night!?! And the general manager Muthuramesh didn’t have the spine to stand up to him, and told us so to our face! Oh and this hotel’s favourite line is “this isn’t lip service”. For every mess they make, they use that line.

They even refused to refund our money! For the additional 2 nights we hadn’t yet spent, we insisted and finally after 1.5 hours of waiting on the porch (with Kids) got a cancellation confirmation on email, else we would have been charged for that as well. The 3 nights stay here would have been around $1000! So definitely no small change. 

This is not a luxury hotel for this kind of terrible service. I honestly dnt know how they have received these awards. They didn’t have a first aid kit with necessary items. Just dettol and betadine solution. They weren’t able to respond to simple queries on food or travel around nuwara. While we were waiting for our refund, we saw 3 other customers arguing with the staff about payment issues, delayed taxis,etc. there are already reviews on that. 

Just writing this reminds us of the shock of being told to leave over such an irrelevant conversation and the panic of trying to find a hotel on Christmas Eve with two kids. 

Thankfully the Grand had a last room available on Christmas Eve and Christmas turned out to be wonderful. We should have just gone there in the first place! That’s far superior and you will have a much better experience. Please don’t make the mistake of booking at Blackpool ever!
title: Avoid

text:
The location of the hotel is amidst lush green tea plantation...simply excellent and the weather is at par with European countries. The ambience of the hotel is generally good, surrounded by lot of vegetation and flower garden. 

We visited this hotel for 2 days with a family of 6 members, when we left 1 member was down with severe gastroenteritis and 3 with upset stomach. The quality of food and hygiene is pathetic. On both days we had same menu for breakfast as well as dinner, with a variation of 1 or 2 items.

Also, the house keeping staff is friendly, however they take forever to attend to you - expect at least 30 mins to 1 hour time delay for any room servicing request.

Overall decent hotel with lot of scope for improvement in food and house keeping area.
title: Excellent location, pathetic food and service

ownerResponse/connectionToSubject: Leader of the House, Resident Manager
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Shamila,
Thank you for the comments you have shared in the TripAdvisor..
We have reviewed your comments and ascertained that you checked during very early hours in the morning.
The restaurant Team members have checked with yourself pertaining to your basis and it was found out that the package starts with dinner. Consequently, they have billed you for the breakfast. Thereafter, on your request the Team members have cancelled the bill.
The Blackpool is a Hotel of repute particularly for the unassuming service standards, delicious food and top notch hospitality.
We are astonished to learn that you experienced very rude staff which is very remote.
Many a comment we have received are mainly on the friendliness of the Staff.
Please do no take this event as a point of judgement, however, visit us again and the The Blackpool Hotel team members will take care of you immensely.

With best wishes,

R.Muthuramesh
Leader of the House
Resident Manager
placeInfo/address: Mahagastota Hill Climb Blackpool, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: The hotel is lovely and amenities are very good. However, staff need to be more customer friendly and competent. I was wrongly billed twice over for breakfast and when I protested it was cancelled without even a hint of apology. The heater is turned up so high during the nights, it made me wonder if I had booked a stay in the desert instead!!Disappointing.
title: Rude incompetent staff ruin a lovely hotel

ownerResponse/connectionToSubject: Leader of the house, Resident Mnager
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Sir,

Thank you for the comments you have posted 
The Blackpool Hotel is strategically located which showcases natural verdant surroundings around the Hotel.
In retrospect the Hotel has hosted countless number of guests and nigh on  all guests have showered their appreciation with regard to the rooms, dining areas, outdoor pool and the location.
The Hotel consists of three modern elevators which facilitates ease of travel to any location within the Hotel. In addition each building is closely connected and guests rarely find it dreary to walk around.
We are surprised that you found it tedious to move around.
One of our unique features is the outdoor warm water pool and many guests do enjoy a dip after a arduous day. The temperature maintained in the  pool is  reasonably warm at all times.

Best wishes,

R.Muthuramesh
Leader of the House
Resident Manager
placeInfo/address: Mahagastota Hill Climb Blackpool, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text: Stayed here 2 nights as part of  Sri Lanka tour. The room was clean & comfortable but the trip to the reception & restaurant meant going down in a lift, walking outside across a path, along a corridor and down in another lift. A long way to go back to fetch a cardigan because the dining room was blinking freezing. The menu was very limited and not to our taste. The room's balcony had no furniture. The pool was weird, too cold anyway! Couldn't wait to leave.
title: Cold & no atmosphere

placeInfo/address: Kubukkadanwala, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
We sit here at 3.15pm still waiting for our dark and dingy room to be cleaned on our 2nd day here, whilst wanting an afternoon snooze but can’t until they do the supposedly daily clean. This is after two phone calls to reception asking for it to happen!
Location… In short miles from anywhere and certainly not anywhere near Dambulla.
Unless you have your own transport they have you by the balls with ridiculously over priced drinks and below average buffets.
Never have we stayed in such a low light room. By which we mean even with every internal light turned on it is impossible to read a normal book.
We are here as part of a group tour, so somewhat locked in, but not tour operators fault.
Every person on our tour has had an issue… Air con not working, Air con remote batteries flat, No hot water, Broken hair dryer, Weird safe with no instructions, No towel rack, No coffee sachets, Electric jug not working, Coffee mate curdling coffee… and more.
We genuinely hate posting negative reviews but this place deserves no better!
title: On group tour so no choice but would not otherwise stay!

placeInfo/address: Kubukkadanwala, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
Never has somewhere been so misnamed!

I’ll start with the positives, large room, efficient air conditioning, lovely gardens, good size pool and wonderful staff.

Our room, described as ‘ Enjoy a magnificent space… The Duplex room promises guests an unforgettable stay with everything needed for total comfort’. 

As long as by ‘magnificent’ and ‘every comfort’ you don’t mind shabby furniture, light fittings, bathroom, bedding and towels then you will not be disappointed.  

Nothing has been looked at closely in this room (703) for years, it needs a complete remodel and everything replacing.

Even the basics were missing, two coat hangers and one (office type) chair to sit on on the balcony…

I don’t write this review with any pleasure but the hotel really should be marketing itself differently as the photos and description were not my reality in any shape or form. 

My review in no way reflects on the staff, each and every person we met was warm, welcoming & professional.
title: Dreadful

placeInfo/address: Kubukkadanwala, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
Wir haben nach einem langem Aufenthalt in Sigiriya ein „ruhiges Hotel“ in der Nähe gesucht, damit wir uns ausruhen können vor unserer 5 Stunden Autofahrt nach Kalutara.

Angekommen an der Rezeption haben wir eine Stunde gewartet bis uns jemand überhaupt einen Schlüssel gegeben hat. Komplett verschwitzt und genervt sind wir dann ins Zimmer gegangen. 

Der Air Conditioner hat bedingt funktioniert, die Schalter waren kaputt. 

Positiv hervorzuheben war, dass es leise war.

Während wir versucht haben zu duschen ist uns aufgefallen, dass das heiße Wasser nicht funktioniert hat.

Klar, hätten wir „Bescheid geben“ können, waren aber komplett kaputt und hätten uns bei einem 5 Sterne Hotel über Booking.com (was kein 5 Sterne Hotel ist) was Besseres erwartet . 

Die Nacht war eine Katastrophe. Viel zu heiß.

Am Morgen danach haben wir uns beschwert. Dafür haben wir ein 20 Prozent Refund bekommen.

Das ist natürlich nur eine subjektive Meinung, aber unsere Erfahrung in einem teuren Hotel.
title: Für uns war das nichts

placeInfo/address: Kubukkadanwala, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Avoid this hotel if you are looking for a clean place to stay
text:
This hotel could be so much better since the location and surrounding nature is very nice but unfortunately it is not up to international standards and far away from being a wellness or luxury hotel.

Rooms
I switched rooms because the air condition was extremely loud in my first room + the bathroom was filthy (mold in shower, surfaces haven’t been cleaned in weeks/months etc). The second room was better regarding the noise of the AC but the bathroom was similarly filthy. I desinfected the toilet myself. There was dirt everywhere and no proper cleaning seems to happen in this hotel.  
Bed sheets and mattress also full of spots. 

Pool
The pool itself is nice. The (newly installed?) water fountain doesn’t make any sense to me, it just makes the place noisier.
The pool bar and staff is underwhelming. Staff inattentive, you have to ask for everything starting with a towel and topper for the sunbeds. Foods and drinks can be ordered but don’t expect the staff to come and ask you if you would like to order something… drinks were fine, food arrived cold.

Pool towels/towels sometimes with spots and/or bad smell.

Public shower and toilet by the pool are also in a disgusting condition, same as in the room.

Restaurant
I booked half board and the variety of food was good and as expected. No complaints here. 
The staff in the restaurant is much better than at the pool. 
However, cleanliness issues are also present here. Table cloths show dirt from dinner the day before etc…

Apparently the hotel is under a new management and in the process of renovating the rooms, as I was told twice while raising the issues with management. I don’t see how the very basics like regularly cleaning the rooms can be excused by a new management… this should be one of the core processes in a hotel. This hotel lacks basic standards. There is enough staff around to make this hotel better but no one seems to care. 

Overall my stay was disappointing and I expected much more. Directly after checkin in I felt that I had made a mistake by booking this hotel.

To be fair, management apologized and dropped my additional room charges (in a rather complicated process with lots of waiting in the lobby) which was nice but I’d rather stayed in a clean hotel instead that had met my expectations.
title: Filthy hotel with lots of lost potential

text:
Pasamos allí 2 noches, yo tenía cabaña para mí sola y dos parejas del grupo una cabaña por pareja. En principio pintaba bastante bien, pero en la realidad dejaba mucho que desear. 
Cabañas chulísimas, espaciosas, pero en las que faltaba limpieza y se veían deficiencias, como que la puerta del baño al exterior tenía un gran espacio por debajo por el que podían colarse toda clase de bichos, la ducha, con dos alcachofas a las que no le han quitado la cal desde que las colocaron, la silicona de la mampara, un poco sucilla, y, para rematar, por la ducha entraban sapos. El personal sacó a uno de mi ducha, y cuando fui a ducharme, lavándome el pelo obviamente tenía los ojos cerrados, pues al abrirlos, otro sapo mirándome. No es nada agradable ducharse pensando que el sapo iba a saltar hacia mí. Y ya, pues el resto de la estancia, mirando por todos los rincones, no descansé nada. Creo que la cadena @barcelohoteles debería prestar más atención a sus hoteles por el mundo, a ese alojamiento le sobra alguna estrella.
La única tarde libre en la que podíamos disfrutar de las instalaciones, no pudimos usar la piscina porque el agua estaba verde, no se veía el fondo.
No todo fue malo, el buffet era bastante bueno y el personal amable, aunque a veces les decías algo, te decían que ahora iban, y te quedabas esperando...
title: Le sobra alguna estrella

placeInfo/address: Kubukkadanwala, Dambulla 21100 Sri Lanka
text:
We had 3 nights here in February, using the hotel as a convenient base for exploring the cultural heartland of Sri Lanka.  It's especially close to a couple of the key sights - including Sigiriya and the Dambulla cave temple.  It's a good hour or so from Polonnaruwa and Anuradhapura.

Having arrived via quiet, rural roads passing paddy fields and lakes, the hotel on first appearances looks impressive, and actually the expansive, lush grounds and the way rooms are grouped in separate buildings makes for the feeling of seclusion, peace and quiet. As the hotel is not that old, and for the most part it has not suffered too much deterioration or neglect (as it unfortunately seems building lovely, luxury hotels and then not investing in them to keeping things working seems to be a common and besetting Sri Lankan hotel sin, not unique to this hotel) we were initially very happy.  There were a few niggles with the room – curtains that do not close or keep out the light, umpteen light switches which made no sense or did nothing, power sockets in inconvenient places for charging devices, but again pretty commonly found in other hotels.   

I would warn though that the hotel website is inaccurate and if you are selecting it for specific mentioned amenities and facilities, beware.

Of the restaurants mentioned, only the large buffet restaurant is operational. We could not find the second evening restaurant, it’s clearly closed and the space repurposed.  The pizza restaurant is a small building near the pool that has clearly not been used, judging by the grime and mess, for ages.       

The area close to the pool described as changing facilities have nowhere dry to change nor anywhere to leave clothes, plus the shower at these facilities have no shower mat so best to change in your room even if it’s some distance away, and we got no robes and slippers.  They really serve as just a toilet close to the pool area.   

Some room categories are listed as having a jacuzzi.  Ours had one (as we got a room upgrade).  However, it was outside on a patio beyond a locked door from our bathroom and we could see from peering over the wall from our side patio that the jacuzzi and the whole area was neglected, filthy and probably no longer working.  Not sure if others are in a similar state of disrepair.          

Other disappointments included:

Major failings in regard to the day to day dining room, catering and kitchen operations and a lack of hands on management showing any interest.  I won’t go into details because after 2 complaints were made to the hotel on our behalf by our very proactive travel organiser, we did receive apologies and a bottle of wine on our last evening.  I would strongly advise for the widest menu choices and sufficient food, you go for dinner the moment the dining room opens, especially if the hotel is full of large tour groups. 

The second general aspect needing improvement is overall customer facing staff training and consistent service levels.  Reception was often unmanned, and nearby staff who offer assistance in their absence are willing but unreliable.  Turn down service seems to be hit and miss, we had charming staff our first night, never saw them after that and nor did the room next door.  When we needed more bottled water, we had a long wait.   Also, it was very clear staff are not just badly trained, some blatantly work for tips.  Yet there was an entire cricket team of smiley staff constantly sweeping leaves and tidying up the grounds.   

This is a hotel that could be a marvellous 5 star hotel – the facilities are mostly all there, but it seems the current operators are not interested and with tourism numbers on the increase, are filling their hotel anyway.
title: So disappointing

text: Two of us stayed at this hotel two years ago. It was better than in every way - rooms were cleaner and felt fresher, the service was friendlier etc. I had recommended this hotel to family. We returned to the hotel this weekend, together with relatives who also booked a stay. We stayed in a room for three adults on the 4th floor. It was an oddly configured layout but aside from that the AC units didn’t work - they kept shutting off during the night and then spluttering back to life loudly - so loud that we woke up multiple times in the night every time it restarted. Probably about 8 or 9 times during the night! One of the units was also malfunctioning to the point that it was spraying out a fine mist of water (sounds nicer than it was) so one of our bags On the floor beneath the unit it was damp the whole time until we realised. Our relatives on the 6th floor reported the same issues with their room plus a blocked bathroom sink. On check-out, the staff were perfectly pleasant but didn’t even ask how our stay was. The service this time around was generally lacking. Thankfully we only booked to stay two nights. I won’t return or recommend going forward.
title: It used to be great, now not worth it. There are so many better options.

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Nuwan,

Thank you for your feedback, but we do not appreciate your negative and incorrect comments especially when our colleague she was found to be rightfully doing what she was instructed to do by your organisation

To put into perspective, when you arrived to the hotel, you were booked through your organisation for isolation purposes and that meant that you are mandated to stay in your room at all times and musisolate in regulation with your organisation and shipping vessel requirements to ensure that you maintain your Covid-19 negative status until you board the vessel.

This also goes to mean that you cannot have anyone in the room with you and cannot have your wife with you either, but despite our best efforts in informing you of these regulations which your company has requested you to abide by, it fell on deaf ears and it is not fair for you to hold that against us and therein make falsified accusations in a public forum that you were delayed in check-in and that our colleague mis-treated you.

All our colleague did was inform you that you can stay in the room and but your wife would not be able to join in the same room as it was against your own company regulation. 

As for your room, according to our records, your room was ready, but you had decided that you would go out for a bit before returning to check-in as you wanted to spend more time with your wife as she was not permitted to check-in to the same room with you and this is again in line with your company requirements.

Your wife then decided to book a separate room to stay overnight but then this was only a ruse as we have clear evidence that you did break the company protocol and grant her access to your room. 

We as such take this review as a form of rebellious action from you to hurt our reputation.

text: First of all ,I came to checking very late around 5:00 pm but still the room was not ready and the receptionist(Dilki)asked half an hour more to wait. ownerResponse/text:
Dear MRJ2121,

Thank you very much for your critical feedback and for sharing your feelings openly on a public forum. We truly appreciate your feedback, but we must take this opportunity to elaborate on some facts which you have brought to our attention.

1. We at Mandarina Colombo dare not discriminate. We welcome guests from all 4 corners of the globe and we welcome them with open arms, like Michael Jackson said, "it don't matter if your black or white" and that goes without saying "it don't matter to us if you are gay or straight". We as a hotel want our guests to be happy and are in the business of making sure our guests love the hotel, their stay and feel refreshed before they checkout. It is very sad that we have not been able to uphold this promise to you and we have taken action against it where we have initiated a training program internally to highlight this very fact.

2. Yes, the hotel has gone through a tough time and understandably with Covid-19 being the cause of all the doom and gloom all over the world, the hotel too has had a tough time with the upkeep and maintenance, especially when we had to stretch thin in the past 2 years to keep the hotel operational with zero tourists and as such much of the maintenance issues you have raised are now being rectified with all seriousness and it goes without saying, the entire building is being critically looked into from a maintenance stand point but will be back to its glory in no time.

3. We are not a Halal Hotel by definition, but yes we do refrain from selling/serving or permitting liquor or alcohol consumption which is our prerogative and but  you are more than welcome to help yourself to drinks outside the hotel in the many bars/clubs located in Colombo.. This very fact is also highlighted in all online Forums where we publicly come out on being a dry concept property.

4. Housekeeping too has been a major impacted area and what you have observed is 100% right and we would not deny it. Again with much of the hotel operation having to be thinned out for the last 2 years, we have now had to get back in gear and that means hiring new associates and that is not easy when the workforce in the country is actively seeking to go overseas for employment, but we have now sought our employees and we are surely getting back on track to ensure that all guest rooms are cleaned faster, better and on demand.

5. As for the chairs, we have an option for guests who would like to take that extra precaution and stay in the room and who would like to have their meals delivered to the room and as such keeping in line with their wishes, we have a chair outside where the food is left for the guest to take into their room. 

6. As for the pool/restaurant, well we are a city hotel and we have to make do with the land which is available to us and as such, we can only go up and the building has been designed to ensure we have all the amenities of a worthy city hotel. Personal preferences may differ, some may not like to be seen when in the pool and some may not like to be seen when having their meal, but we definitely understand that we cannot satisfy 100% of the guests 100% of the time.

We sincerely do hope that we have been able to clarify much of your personal opinions about the hotel but would have loved it and sincerely appreciated if these concerns would have been brought directly to us during your stay as opposed to a public post after the stay as it not only hurts the property who is trying to revive its place in the post Covid-19 era and also deprives us from ensuing that we learn on the job by interacting with our guests.and show how genuinely humbled we are in ensuring our guests have a good stay.
placeInfo/address: 433 Galle Road Colombo 03, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: This was the worst hotel I stayed in Sri Lanka. I had high hopes as the photos look really nice. They price showed as $130 USD and it was marked down to $58USD. At this property, you get what your pay for. First off the room was not clean. The ceiling was stained from the AC unit, the bathroom had a styrofoam square covering something, and the sink was full of black mold. There was construction so you could not go on the balcony- I get that and understand they are remodeling. The staff was not friendly at all. When we booked we did not know this was a halal hotel. I don’t have an issue with that but my boyfriend thinks they were not friendly to us because we are gay. I try to put faith in humanity and think they were just not friendly people and did not discriminate because were gay. There was baseboard missing by the entry way.  We got back to the hotel at 3pm and our room was not cleaned. We asked the guy actively cleaning other rooms so we asked him to clean out and he say it was next. Maybe he did not clean because two guys were staying there?! Who knows. There was also random chairs outside of each room except ours, not sure the meaning behind that. Last the pool was small and there was not an area to lay out by the pool. It was an awkward set up because the people eating at the restaurant could easily see you in the pool. The rooftop is also under remodeling. When we checked out people were also not friendly. I did ask them to print out a few documents and they did that complementary.  I don’t recommended for anyone to stay here so please spend your money elsewhere. See photos below.
title: What A Dump

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 

Thank you very much for your feedback but i believe that you have gravely mistaken us for another property.

The reason is because of several factors.

1. We do not employ casual labour in our property, all our associates are 100% permanent and so there is no possibility for anyone to claim that they are casual labour.

2. We operate a central heating system/boiler which provides 24/7 hot water and does not have a room to room system for maintenance as its all centrally controlled and so if there was no hot water in your room then this would be the case in several other rooms, which cannot be as we had no other instances of this nature.

3. As for the AC, again we operate an individual AC unit per room and this is so that the guests have full control of how they would like the comfort level to be in the room and since all our units are regularly checked and so there could not be any possibility that any unit was malfunctioning.

Furthermore, you have stated that you have stayed with us on 31st October 2020, but yet the review is posted on 13th October 2020. How could it be possible for you to have stayed on 31st October 2020, when we are still only half way through October as a month.

We are glad that you did find the food and beverage to be good along with the pool, but yet we think it would be unfair for us to take the positive feedback as ours as we believe that the entire feedback has been written in grave error.

We sincerely do hope that you will seek out the correct property next time before writing a review.

Warm Regards, 

Sales Manager

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Valued Guest,

Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback following your recent stay with us at Colombo Court Hotel & Spa. We truly regret to hear that your experience did not meet your expectations.

Please allow us to clarify regarding the charge for the bed linen. Our housekeeping and supervisory team thoroughly inspected the room upon your departure, and it was evident that the bed sheet had significant stains caused by food gravy. We would like to reassure you that it is not our practice to charge guests for minor marks or light stains, as we understand occasional wear and tear is part of normal hotel use.

However, in this case, the gravy stains were deep and permanent, despite our laundry team’s best efforts to restore the linen. As a result, the linen was deemed unfit for reuse. In such instances, we are left with no option but to apply a minimal charge to cover the damage, which was clearly communicated at checkout.

We sincerely regret if this caused disappointment and assure you that the decision was made only after careful review.

Regarding the concern about room ventilation, we will review your room allocation and share the feedback with our team to ensure all comfort standards are met consistently.

We value all our guests and appreciate your feedback as it helps us continue to improve. Should you choose to return to Colombo, we would be grateful for the opportunity to welcome you again and provide you with a more seamless and enjoyable experience.

Best Regards 
The Colombo Court Hotel & Spa Family

DO NOT BOOK this hotel if you’re planning to at least till next month. There’s an ongoing construction going on in this property whole day, starting from 8AM all you hear is a loud drilling noise. No mirror in the room. You have to go to washroom all the time to use the mirror which i found very very annoying and the mirror also a half torso so you cannot see your full outfit. For me this is s big NO. 
There was no ventilation system in the washroom. Wasroom door was quite annoying because of the way it closes with a noise. 
SriLankan breakfast was soo average and tasteless. And it costs about LKR2400 +. They have only alar carte menu for breakfast and no buffet. 

Staff was very nice,friendly and very supportive. Very convenient location.

text:
We needed a place to rest before leaving for the airport for a 4 am flight. The reviews of Colombo Court Hotel and Spa were very good so we chose to stay here. When we arrived at about 3, we asked the front desk to book a car to take us to the airport at 1:30 am. Around 6:30, I reconfirmed the car booking and was told that the car would be there at 1:20.

We tried to sleep, but the room that we were given 209, was above the pool, a bar and a common area and had a window that allowed all the noise into the room. I had my earplugs in and covered my ears with my pillow, but still couldn't sleep until about 11 pm.

We went downstairs at 1:20 and waited for the car. By 1:30, the car still wasn't there, so we asked the front desk to follow up and were told that it would be there in 2 to 3 minutes. 10 minutes later, it still hadn't arrived so we insisted that the front desk call another car. They made a call and we were told that it would be another "2 to 3 minutes'.  Finally at 1:47, the car arrived. No idea if it was the original or 2nd car.

Naturally, the driver had to speed to the airport so that we would get there in time to check in and go through immigration. It was raining and I wasn't comfortable at all with how fast he was having to drive. The entire experience was very frustrating and anxiety-ridden, which was what I had tried to avoid by booking the car well in advance.

We were most unimpressed with our experience here. I don't like leaving negative reviews, but this is our experience.
title: Wish I could recommend this hotel, but I can't

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Ms. Jennifer Jaliel, 

Thank you so much for your feedback regarding your high tea reservation at the Amber Poolside. 

Please accept my sincere apologies for any inconvenience caused. 

After investigating this matter with my team, I came to understand that you had corresponded with my restaurant manager Nalin. All sufficient information such as a menu, pricing, and reservation details has been shared with you. He has also assisted you with regard to your meal preferences as well. Going further into my investigation I did come to notice that he had specifically requested if you would like us to replace anything on the menu. Which obviously includes the beverage item as well. However, you had responded back to him stating "nothing to replace" which gives us the impression that you are confident about the menu option you selected. Therefore, this clearly shows that there has been a clear misunderstanding on your end regarding the hot and cold beverage items. If you were not happy with the Iced Coffee option, you had all right to speak to our restaurant staff and replace the cold beverage with a hot one. 

Furthermore, with regard to the behavior of the restaurant staff, I have taken the necessary action by conducting training, and workshops on this matter so that they are well-trained and mannered. We will make sure sure this does not happen to any other guest. 

Thank you once again for your feedback and we look forward to welcoming you soon. 

Best Regards
Kevin Schumacher

roomTip: I took it for granted that tea would be served at a High Tea so please check all the details and not take anything for granted.
text:
Went for the High Tea and specifically the English High Tea as they have a Sri Lankan as well. Was totally disappointed as we were not served any hot beverages nor offered any. It was really baffling that you call it a High Tea and tea was not served. One of the staples of a high tea is tea and Sri Lanka is BTW a tea drinking nation. I took this for granted and never really asked or checked if a hot beverage would be served and we waited quite some time before we realized that nothing was been served. 

We were the only two (02) guests there on this day and found the ambiance of the restaurant very disturbing. There were a few staff who were having a very loud conversation, which continued throughout our stay there, which we found very disturbing. One of the golden rules of F&B staff is to be discreet and respectful not rowdy.
title: English High Tea

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr. Mendoza, 

Thank you so much for your feedback. 

First and foremost, please accept my sincere apologies for the inconvenience that you had to go through during your stay. 

The AC machine had leaked due to a block in the AC drain lines. Before your arrival, our housekeeping team and the maintenance team check every single aspect of the room before it’s released to a guest. We inspect electrical items, furniture, bathrooms, balconies, and even the paint condition. The AC machine was also adequately serviced before your arrival. Having investigated this matter we came to know that these sorts of incidents happen once in a blue moon and we were so unfortunate to go through this. 

However, after discussing the matter with you and with your permission we sent the laptop to a local agent, and they confirmed that the computer can be recovered only if the motherboard is replaced. We also checked with them about the possibility of getting this done immediately. Unfortunately, the process would take 1 to 2 months since the agent has to order the parts from Singapore which will consume a lot of time. 

We also spoke to our insurance company, and we got 75% coverage for the laptop. This has been communicated to you and we are still awaiting your confirmation to proceed with the transaction.
 
As a responsible business, to avoid such unfortunate incidents, we have decided to replace all drain lines of the hotel with AC machines. The project has been handed over to the local agent. 

Once again, we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused and we wish we had control over these sorts of incidents so they can be avoided. 

Best Regards
The Management.

text:
Room is good, I stayed in 205. There's a separate living room and you would need to take a 5 steps without rails going to the bedroom so be careful. 
It's a noisy room, you will hear all those Split type AC from the Toilet and making it a very hot place as well.
Staffs are good and courteous.
The only problem is:
While I was sleeping, the AC was leaking, there was a water dripping from the blower to the whole area underneath as strong as a faucet. The electrical socket underneath tripped (luckily it tripped or else i will produce a spark and create a fire while I was sleeping). I only felt it because it became hotter due to the tripped breaker. The whole desk area under the AC blower was wet including my very special company  laptop pc and until now it has not been paid to my company. My timesheet and work reports for 2 weeks that I need to send from that PC was until now delayed. Therefore my salary and all reimbursement will be delayed as well.

Another thing, if there’s an event down at the hotel, you will be hearing it in your room. As I am a very quiet and private person, it's not a good place to stay.

text: I booked this hotel after reading good reviews but after staying in small but good hotels in locations like Marissa and Galle , we had bit expectations from this hotel. After all it has won lot of awards which was displayed at the reception. It’s March month and Sri Lanka is hot and our nightmare started once we entered in our red hot room. Room interior is good but what would you do with the interiors if the split AC installed is 20 years old. The AC was just not cooling the room. We called reception people and they sent the technician immediately. Technician did the obvious job of cleaning the filter and told us to wait for 30 minutes. He himself realised the AC is not working. But then who would convince reception people. I am writing this review sitting in hotel same hot room waiting to get cool. The hotel should be proactive considering there is no one else staying because of corona scare. We had such wonderful time at location like Mirissa, Galle and Bentota, but this hotel ruined our beautiful experience of srilanka with its horrible service. Hope this review reaches them tonight because they don’t care of guests burning in their room. Like I said above and I am stressing again, never go with looks. We did this mistake but I don’t want others to suffer. Thanks
title: Don’t go with reviews. Pretty looking hotel but shallow

text:
The saving grace was the staff who did everything in their power to make things as comfortable as possible, The manager Mohd Razzaq was wonderful. We want to thank Mohd the bell Captain who did his best. 
   The one restaurant that was poolside had a very limited menu and being as the food was prepared a distance from the pool where one ate it was often cold. 
   The electricals in the room were mostly not functioning. 
    I would suggest calling and asking where they are in the renovation before booking. 
   The front door was broken which was sliding and had to be opened manually.
title: Would have been nice to have been informed half the hotel was closed for renovation. It is not a 5 star property!

placeInfo/address: 32 Alfred House Ave, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: Beware booking something with them for 31 December. They operate a dubious policy of not displaying the total cost of booking. I got an email confirmation from booking.com with the price of 207 gbp for two nights, and later separate email from the hotel requesting additional payment of 85 USD per head for the Gala Dinner. They will refer to you to a small print (hidden, you have to click to see it) which says there is compulsory surcharge. It does not say it is ON TOP of what the price says in an email from booking.com. Surprisingly booking.com is ok with such policy. The hotel is not willing to understand the issue either.
title: Beware Pricing Policy

placeInfo/address: 32 Alfred House Ave, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: We had booked a suite with extra bed we were a group of 20 people and what we got was an exceptionally small room. don’t be fooled by the pictures posted by the hotel on the website . Although the architecture is awesome needless to say it was very lackadaisical attitude by the staff to give us such a small room. Not to forget the extra bed was charged @ $50 a night .
title: Great Hotel small rooms a word of caution

placeInfo/address: 32 Alfred House Ave, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
I was very much looking forward to m stay at this hotel base on all the reviews I read and the photos. The communication with the staff ahead of time was helpful and airport pick up st 0530 after long international flights was much appreciated. 

BUT in no way was I prepared for the noise of the location. Sitting by the pool, having a massage, up in my room - everywhere I went I could hear blaring honking car horns and the din of the street. It felt like I was sitting or sleeping right on the street corner. I found the hotel further away from the areas I needed to be in so a Tuk tuk was required for all outings. I appreciate when my hotel is a restorative haven in the midst of an intense city but unfortunately this hotel was anything but...

The room was fine until all the main lights went out and no one could fix them. More of a fuse issue than a burnt out light bulb. The staff tried to help by bringing extra lamps but not ideal. 
I left my stay early as a result of noise and lack of peaceful ambiance. Unfortunately I had paid in advance and that resulted in me losing a nights stay. But at the end of the day it was the best option.
title: Disappointing

placeInfo/address: 32 Alfred House Ave, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text: This place is not worth it, go elsewhere... We stayed for one night at Colombo Court Hotel & Spa, and given we had limited time we contacted them a few days before to organise a driver for 3 hours to take us around the City (we only had one night in Colombo whilst in transit) so wanted to see as much as possible. We organised 2 children's beds with them in the booking, and were really pleased to receive an email saying we had a personal butler who would organise everything and make our stay smooth.... Well it was terrible. On arrival they had the wrong room type set up, then tried to blame us even though we had the supporting documentation, and then they had it set up with only one kids bed. After sorting the rooms we then had to wait an hour for our driver to arrive (even though I had booked him from 3pm-6pm) so here we are in Colombo, wasting our 3 hour site-seeing window because the hotel was useless. Then instead of being honest, they constantly told us that the driver is "here immediately" which was an outright lie because it was an hour wait, with 2 toddlers in the heat whilst missing our opportunity to explore the city. This was extremely frustrating, because if they had been honest about the delay we would have taken a taxi and enjoyed our time in Colombo. Finally a driver arrived, and having explored Colombo with a reduced amount of time because of the hotels delay, we arrive back to find out the hotel had no hot water. Amazing. Unbelievable that we could be paying top dollar for such a terrible experience. Finally they had the audacity to charge us for the 3 hours driver time, even though they had wasted half of that by running late. Do not stay there.
title: Very disapointing experience

placeInfo/address: 32 Alfred House Ave, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
Was at Colombo courtyard in dec  2017 quite disappointed with the look, ambience at the hotel non-descript place which can't be even rated 3 star but charged 5 star rates
Staff was however extremely well-behaved,cordial ,helpful and very nice. 
Not worth the price at all
title: Disappointing

placeInfo/address: 32 Alfred House Ave, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
Oh dear. We so enjoyed our stay here in 2013 - that's why we returned for a 3-night stay, so looking forward to enjoying what we remembered of the hotel with our friend, who was visiting Sri Lanka for the very first time. Never again. My partner and I were put to the inconvenience of moving from a suite to a much less pleasant room on the second day - no hot water! Our friend's suite was a bit of a mess - non-functional bulbs, no lights in the bathroom, a wardrobe door handle falling off. But she gritted her teeth and bore it until the final night when her room was pulsating from the din of a late-night Christmas function in the pool area and she had to be evacuated to another room in her bath robe through a crowd of guests. Meanwhile in our new room we scolded our fingers on burning water (the choice was cold or burning). 

The whole hotel has already seen better days since 2013 - scuffed, stained paintwork, upholstery crying out for refreshment etc etc. And something's certaiinly not working somewhere - staff-wise it was like the left hand didn't know what the right hand was doing.

What really irked us was the 'function' issue. It's not the Cinnamon Grand with large banqueting suites etc - it's a medium-sized boutique hotel and any party just takes over - not only noise-wise - but the Cloud Café rooftop bar and (in the evenings) the poolside area were out of bounds to us for our whole stay. We felt totally marginalised.

Also (on the subject of left hand and right hand apparently being attached to separate bodies) it was a good job we settled our bill the night before our early-morning start for the airport. They set a record. It took more than half an hour!

We so look forward to future return trips to Colombo - but we won't ever stay here again. A total disappointment - and we felt so bad suggseting it to our friend, given the horrid time she had there.
title: Beware - especially in the 'festive season'

placeInfo/address: 32 Alfred House Ave, Colombo 00300 Sri Lanka
text:
These people does not know to make a bill for the items purchased by customers and when the customers correct it,they do not have a way of correcting it.
i visited colombo court today and the bill was settled using the card and after one hour we found that the bill amount is wrong.we went back and  showed it to the waiters and asked to pay the remaining balance by cash.
The cashier rejected it and he wanted the card back to reject the payed amount and again take the correct amount.So much drama and the hotels expects its customers to go and fetch bank accounts to see the transaction was reverted or not. Also the cashier expects that the customer brings the same card all the way back to the hotel when the hotel  does a mistake

This is not what we expect from a organisation in hospitality industry. they should get customer service right big time
title: Worst customer service ever

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
text: Poor services,  no dental kit , no room slippers , low pressure shower , old furniture. Kids pool not functional , shampoo mixed with water ,lunch dinner buffet was also not upto mark and was served cold .Only thing good was friendly staff who seems helpless as nothing was available
title: Don't book this hotel , transit hotel via srilankan Airlines

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
roomTip: A rating of one for service is overly generous.
text: Terrible service, restaurant.  Walked out of restaurant after waiting 1 1/2 hour for entree ordered off the menu that never arrived.  We had paid full price for one night but only staying 4 hours as waiting for 1:30 AM flight to  Doha and then Boston, USA.  We had limited time to get a few hours of sleep before departure so were unwilling to wait for however much longer to receive our meal.
title: Really angry with wait time for meal in restaurant.

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
roomTip: Don't use this hotel.
text:
I visited Sri Lanka, my mother land after 26 years. I booked Ramada through their F&B manager. We worked together in previous hotels in SL. Payments were made, necessary documents were sent and a confirmation were sent to me in writing. On arrival at the hotel reception, I was told to pay an extra LKR 10000 on top of the payment made, because I was not classed as a Sri Lankan. I handed over my Sri Lankan ID card and this was rejected. This was the first time I’ve had my nationality questioned. We then left Ramada and managed to find accommodation in a beautiful hotel in Negombo.
Tourism is booming in Sri Lanka and we have witnessed many overseas travellers coming to my beautiful country, but this type of arrogance and unprofessional behaviour could kill it. Horrible experience. Will not recommend this hotel to anyone.
title: Complaint

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
text: About a 15 minute drive to the airport.  Rooms and bathrooms were just ok and definitely could use a make over. We stayed in the bar area and ordered food which was just ok.  The bartenders were very nice and friendly. The bar area was a little dingy.
title: Disappointed

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
roomTip: Avoid this hotel
text:
The hotel looks modern and posh. But there is a terrible sound in the rooms. The food is really bad. There is no taste at all. Very disappointing experience after all the good food we had in Sri Lanka. You better can stay somewhere else!

Do not eat here and stay somewhere else!
title: Looks good, is very bad

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
roomTip: Avoid this hotel.. especially if u r an international traveller.They try to trap and squeezeoney from you
text:
I had been here with my girl crowd of 14 in the month of August 2024. Selected this hotel through a tour company thinking it's good & very near to the airport. Little did v know that they fool people by charging bottled water given with takeaway complimentary breakfast. V had an early flight by 8.20 am & had to report to Airport by 5.30 am. They adjusted for a not so wide spread complimentary dinner and toast and omlette for BF. The dinner menu was limited and not upto the mark. Swimming pool poorly maintained. 
The next day morning, they gave us bottled water for a charge when the manager had vouched and agreed for a small take away menu with water included. V returned the entire water bottle to the staff and left for airport. 

Please think twice or thrice before booking this place as they don't have customer courtesy.
title: Deception @ its best

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
text:
Airline sent us here after missed connection.
Worst hotel I’ve stayed in for 30 years. 
Rooms reek of cigarettes.
Sheets had not been changed on beds. Other travelers in our group had bed bugs.
Only one towel per couple in bathroom and when another was asked for, was told there were none available.
No soap in bathroom for hand washing.
Breakfast buffet was stone cold.
Even though airline covered lunch and dinner too, we left and went elsewhere.
Roof leaks in corridors when it rains and evidence of water damage in rooms and hallways.

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
text:

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka

text: It was average transfer hotel however check in and out takes too long also, special book request was not handle properly it makes uncomfortable at the end. Overall I can say just average hotel but need more skilled staffs.

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
text:
We booked this hotel due to its proximity to the airport as we had an early morning flight. 

The airport transfer from the hotel cost R2150 and it was very convenient. 

The hotel itself however, and the staff, were both very poor. 

The rooms smell badly of damp, the a/c doesn’t work, the tiles on the balcony are broken and loose, the balcony door doesn’t close etc etc - it’s very run-down! I would guess the rooms have not been upgraded for 15-20 years. 

Additionally, and without wanting to identify specific people, the entire staff need proper training in how to communicate with guests and service standards. 

There must be a better option in equally close proximity to the airport.
title: There must be a better option...

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
text: Please avoid this hotel at any cost. Pathetic service through and through. Took the reception 45 mins to check in 3 people in 2 rooms. Then at lunch it took them 1 hour to get 3 dishes and the same at dinner. Finally when we were exhausted and wanted to sleep, we realized that the doors that were connecting two rooms were not locked and could be opened from either side. On top of that the rooms weren’t even sound proof. The rooms stink and the carpets and upholstery is stained. The air conditioner takes forever to cool down the room. Not sure if there is anything left to complain. Oh yes when you complain about all of the above the staff looks at you like they don’t understand. Never coming back here. Ever. Ramada should be ashamed to call this a hotel.
title: Most pathetic stay ever

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
text:
We chose the Ramada because we needed an overnight near the airport in Colombo before heading out to Nuwara Eliya, and because we know the Ramada is a good hotel chain.  However, it was a disappointment.

First, we had corresponded with the hotel to arrange for free airport pickup.  Response was slow in coming, but we did eventually get the information.  Upon landing, someone was supposed to meet us with a sign, but no one was there.  A nice guard called the hotel for us, as we had no cell service.  The driver eventually showed up and we were taken to the hotel.

At check in, I asked if the room had the bed arrangements we had requested and was told yes.  We opened the door to see that the room did not have the bedding we had reserved.  So we went back down to the counter and waited while they worked this out (we were tired after a late fight and really just wanted to sleep).  The second room, thankfully, was the one we had reserved.

In the morning, we walked into the breakfast room and sat down.  Our place mats were covered in stains, and mine had two knives instead of the usual fork, knife spoon.  The lack of cleanliness was really a turn off, and I was happy we were staying only one night.

This was just a sad hotel much in need of a facelift and some customer service training that I would have expected Ramada to provide.  I would not stay here again.
title: Not the Ramada you are used to

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
text:
The hotel is definitely on the lower end of the scale when it comes to Ramada properties. The pros are few in number: the property is near to the airport, it seems to have a shuttle bus to the airport (we didn’t use it - made our own arrangements), the staff are nice and the kitchen makes a very competent Sri Lankan curry. 

But the rooms are dated and faded, and we had a problem with the air conditioner which had a bad leakage issue which required a change of room. Credit where credit is due: the team eventually shifted our room to another one nearby and they had quite full occupancy so this was not an easy fix. This was kind of them and in fact the staff as mentioned were very good in general. However the air conditioner in the changed room, whilst it didn’t drip, didn’t actually work and the room was roasting. Not what you want the night before a flight, which I suspect is what most people choose the Ramada for. 

The rooms feel in need of a deep clean, the halls are (to be frank) rather musty and it’s a bit of a rabbit warren, with long halls to walk down with luggage (there is only one lift). It’s quite dark and dingy throughout. Breakfast is unremarkable at best. Some bathrooms have a pronounced and dangerous tile lip where the door meets the hallway which we stubbed our toes on (as in, we ALL did) and needed to put a towel on it to de-risk things! 

Last and important point: the wifi is patchy as hell (didn’t work for most of the stay) and when it did work the bandwidth was poor. I imagine a number of people rely on the wifi just before a flight to load up on downloaded Netflix or Prime Video content and the Ramada Katunayake will be of virtually zero utility in this regard. They also give you internet passes per device to manually cap the devices you can use, which is a blaringly loud warning sign that the internet facilities do not pass muster.

Choose another place, I think we were considering a Taj property nearby and maybe that would have been a better option.
title: Not recommended

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
text:
Got booked here as close to the airport, possibly the only advantage. 
Food is Sri Lankan, could not eat much as vegetarian. Rooms are ordinary but large in size. Staff is friendly, there is a shuttle to take you to the airport.
Not many channels on the TV. 
Hopefully will not stay here again.
title: Useless hotel

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
text:
Being a Wyndham member i decided to book this hotel as my visit was planned at very last moment. 
While entering i was welcomed rudely by a senior concierge member asking me put my bag into scanner.His junior colleague was kind enough in contrast and brought my bag to reception,allowing me to complete check inn formalities.
I was given a large and dark room on 2nd floor which was not up to mark.Air conditioning in the room was terrible it took almost 3-3.5 for the room to start cool down.They tried changing my room but the alternative was equally bad.
The hotel staff seem to have issue with english communications.I was in the interconnected room and was told that the next room was not occupied but later the night i found that a guest was staying there and had been watching tv with high volume.If you prefer to sleep in dark,you wouldn’t able to sleep due to light of air con controller display. I couldn’t sleep at all.
It was a local hotel which was later taken over by Ramada.its certainly aged and in urgent need of renovation.
Housekeeping is awful and towel,linen etc were bad quality.
Ramada, is this really one of your hotels????
title: Avoid at all cost

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
text:
I was really disappointed with this place,more so as I have been to so many Ramada hotels worldwide.
Reached at around 5 am, still room was not ready and had to wait.
The worst part was the breakfast, the area looked untidy and the tables were not clean with flies hovering the breakfast plate.
Shall never recommend this to anyone.
title: It's not Ramada!

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
text:
We landed in Colombo around 2:45 am and were to spend the night there and head to Kandy post breakfast by 10 am. We (husband, myself and 2 yr old baby) booked ramada as it showed 300m from the airport and thought it has brand value and would be good to reach at that hour.
Pros - airport pickup was good
They put baby bed when asked for.

Cons
1. I requested them for better pricing of room over email before booking as we were to be there only for 6-7 hours. They gave me a good price initially but when I was about to book said that price will be higher as I need the room in morning hours.

2. It is 7.5 KMS away from the airport and not 300 m.

3. They charged us 12 dollars for pickup.

4. When we reached at 3:30 am they asked us to make immidiate payment for room. We said we'll do that in the morning as we were exhausted but they weren't kind enough.

5. Breakfast was very sad with v v limited choices and they charged us for it at check out while we had requested for a discounted rate for room and breakfast. 

6. The bed in the room was smaller than even queen size.

7. The shower knob was missing.

Hope this helps you all and saves you from being cheated
title: CHEATERS of grade 1

placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
text:
On 8Feb2019 we checked in after a late night landing of our flight. The next morning on 9Feb2019 before we checked out we had buffet breakfast at the hotel and paid with our credit card. The staff took a long time to return our credit card and this arouse our suspicion. True enough we had several spurious transactions on 10Feb2019 and had to inform my bank to the block 3 transactions from AliExpress.com for USDLR0.26, Flawless Beauty LLC US for USDLR 44.38 and USDLR91.89

We find the staff who did it is very unprofessional and dishonest as it really ruin the start of our holiday  in Sri Lanka much to our inconvenience. A Red Flag need to be raised on Tripadvisor to warn travellers to this particular Ramada Hotel.

Ramada should rectify the wrongdoing of the Cashier ID 882  as evidenced on their invoice no: 96275 at their Main Restaurant at 9:13 am on 09/02/19 because this incident has caused us great anxiety for the rest of our Journey in Sri Lanka
