ownerResponse/text:
Dear Darrellp,

Thank you for reviewing our Hotel on Trip Advisor, and sharing your detailed review concerning your stay which will help us to improve our Hotel services and the standards.

Please accept my sincere appologies, and I am sure on your next visit your will see the difference.

Looking forward to welcoming you back again soon. 

Regards,
Yusufali
placeInfo/address: 842 Negombo Road, Katunayake, Negombo 11450 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/name: Ramada by Wyndham Katunayake Colombo International Airport
text:
Had the misfortune of been allocated this hotel by Sri Lankan Airlines whilst in transit to and from the Middle East.
Don’t be fooled this is not a “Ramada” as I expected, but probably at best a 3 star with very little going for it.
- Poor location and surroundings, right on Negombo road, nothing to see outside, no beach or shops close by.
-Rooms were clean and ok, but the corridors and room was stinking hot as there is no AC left on. The room AC took about 1 hr to cool the room down. The corridors have no AC so very unpleasant.
-Tried to get some sleep in the early hours 12 am on, but the staff love talking and joking aloud in the corridors with no consideration to the guests.
-breakfast on the first stay was very average, restaurant was hot with flies hovering around.
-Some staff were quite ok and welcoming, some needed training in how to deal with guests.

My second stay (again approx 20 hrs) was slightly better because I apparently got a deluxe room ...but everything else was very similar.

It’s disgraceful that Sri Lankan airways use such low standard hotels for their business class guests in particular.. it will certainly make me think twice of transiting through Colombo on SL airlines if this is their transit accomodation choice for customers.

This hotel really has nothing appealing other than a uncomfortable place to rest whilst transiting for half a day or so.
title: The shorter the stay the better

ownerResponse/text:
Perhaps we should be honoured to receive a 1-star review from Stephen Bechtle, who has a history of such things on other sites, often rounded off by his famous little catchphrase "Nie wieder!"
"Nie wieder" indeed. Regrettably we have had to ban Mr Bechtle from Suite Lanka for life. Not that he will want to visit again. We have many important points to make in response to his comments.
Mr Bechtle's booking was for 1 person, yet he arrived at the hotel with a younger woman who was unable to provide a passport and failed to provide any ID. This is against Sri Lanka regulations, but when this was raised Mr Bechtle became abusive.
Management received several complaints that Mr Bechtle was seen naked on his terrace early the next morning. We do not practice Freikörperkultur at Suite Lanka.
Mr Bechtle paid a heavily discounted price on our cheapest room, demanded an upgrade and then became abusive when he was told this was not possible.
Mr Bechtle insisted on sleeping with his door open at night. When management warned him  that this was a security risk, he again became abusive. Our night security is caring and dutiful and therefore had to spend much of the time keeping a quiet yet diligent eye on his room. This is not "neurotic" behaviour. It is perhaps inadvisable - ironic even - for Mr Bechtle to make such a charge!
Narigama Beach is one of the most famously broad and sandy beaches in Sri Lanka. We carry many photos of it on TripAdvisor. It is a shame that Mr Bechtle feels it is boring and would like it to be a different shape.
We warn all our guests about the possibility of strong sea currents, especially if the weather is poor or if it is outside high season. Sri Lankan seas are dangerous and Mr Bechtle is a man whose best years are behind him. He would have been informed earlier, and advised of the best places to swim, but at the time we were still sorting out his many complaints. The choice where he swims is his alone.
The room size is accurate. The site on which Mr Bechtle booked calculates room size including bathroom and terrace.
The a/c and toilet were checked before and after Mr Bechtle's arrival and they were functioning perfectly well. It is true that we intend to upgrade the bathroom in this room in May 2025 - the next stage in a series of upgrades in the past few years.
It appears from another 1-star review that Mr Bechtle also did not like the food (he forgot to mention this ). We realised this when he was on the point of leaving the hotel without paying for the food eaten either by himself or his lady companion.
Suite Lanka is committed to learning from guest comments, takes many critical points seriously, and uses the knowledge gained to try to improve our service.
During Mr Bechtle's brief stay we had a hotel full of happy and fulfilled guests as our other reviews underline.
But on Mr Bechtle, we have only one further thing to say: "Nie wieder!"
placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
Ich hatte leider keine gute Erfahrung in diesem Hotel.
Der Strand ist sehr breit und eher langweilig. Wirklich schwierig  ist, dass man im Meer nicht schwimmen kann, wegen stärker Unterströmungen. Davor warnt der Hotelmanager, allerdings erst nach dem Check in. Überhaupt scheint das Hotel unter einer gewissen Sicherheitsneurose zu leiden. Permanent läuft ein  Wachmann herum, was das Urlaubsgefühl nicht unbedingt erhöht.
Das Hotel ist deutlich in die Jahre gekommen. Von Sri Lankes Charme ist wenig zu spüren. Die Größe meines Zimmers entsprach nicht den Angaben bei der Buchung. Das Zimmer roch schlecht nach alter  Klimaanlage. Das Wasser war nicht warm. Die Toilettenspülung funktioniert nicht. Zudem hatte ich nachts eine absurde Auseinandersetzung mit dem Hotel Manager, der mich tatsächlich daran hindern wollte, mit offenem Fenster zu schlafen, um dem Gestank zu entgehen. Das empfand ich als extrem unverschämt und übergriffig. Nie wieder!
title: Keine gute Erfahrung!

ownerResponse/text: Ерунда
placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: Отель очень старый, пахнет в номере ужасно, уборка плохая, воду не дают, а наливают в стеклянные бутылки, на кровати стоят подушки большие они очень грязные и в желтых разводах, шторы висят грязные и пыльные, балдахин на кровати тоже весь в пыли, его нужно хоть раз в год стирать я думаю! сервис для меня за такие деньги оказался плохим, в ресторане сделали заказ который ждали 1,5 часа
title: Отель не стоит своих денег даже на 20 процентов

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Rachel,

first of all I thank you for having chosen Suite Lanka as the place to stay on your last night of holiday.
Our first contact was your request for a rate lower than the one offered through booking.com. I offered you a very special rate. You haggled with me a couple of emails, until I gave you a very special price, which I only gave you, because  I had the impression that you were students, exploring Sri Lanka, what I had sympathy for.
When you arrived, you were assigned a room, we call "Superior Plus", which is the size of a Superior room (both Superior rooms were already booked), but with a bit of a higher quality furniture and equipment. It´s a full bedroom with private bathroom and terracce, with a lockable connecting door to our biggest suite (Two bedroom Suite)
You were introduced to the room as we always do it, with A/C, lights and TV switched on. Then you received your welcome drink and went to the beach. Everything seemed to be fine.
In the evening around 10pm I received a call from my manager, informing me, that your A/C was broken (remember, upon check in it was working). My staff tried to reach the maintenance person, who is generally available in case of "emergency" (being located at Ocean Front, we experience heavy seabreeze, especially during the months of may through november. This causes many problems with electrical items such as A/C, lights, electronics). Unfortunately he couldn´t come that late anymore, because he was in Matara at that time (60 km away).
As obviously the AC was required (every room has a strong ceiling fan over the bed as well), we decided to open the connecting door to the Two Bedroom Suite for you. So you didn´t even have to move your things, but only change the bedrooms. Now you had two bedrooms plus a living room ... and 2 functional AC systems. That´s what you called "faffing".
When I greeted you during breakfast, I was not sarcastic at all, but apologized for the broken AC and I was sure, that you were more than happy for how the problem has been solved.
But instead you started instantly to complain, that we should have checked the AC, before checking you in and even asked for a financial compensation. I then realized that obviously you must have been very unhappy about much more incidents, probably throughout your vacation and I left you alone. 
I am sorry, that you didn´t enjoy your stay with us and I wish you a happy winter back in UK.
With kind regards, Roland
placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: Very rude owner, broken ac and huge loud building site next door. We booked this hotel as a nicer place to stay on our last night of holiday. The ac didn't work and after a lot of faffing we were moved to another room in the middle of the night with little in the way of apology. The next room was closer to the building works which went on early in the morning and in the evening. The owner sarcastically asked us in the morning if we were happy with our our room and then pointed out we were getting both fruit and juice and should only get one (even though we hadn't asked for it). I think he is telling himself what was once probably a nice and functional hotel still is, but unfortunately it isn't. On the plus side the rest of the staff were kind and helpful.
title: Noisy building site and rude owner

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Emse Colombo,
first of all I thank you for letting us be a part of your anniversary trip and explicit praising our rooms, restaurant, staff and location. We are constantly working on mantaining a high standard to satisfy all our guests. However sometimes things can go wrong. And even as we are constantly cleaning all areas of the hotel, areas like the parking, which is open and can be accessed by outsiders, can be watched 24/7. Before you arrived, obviously somebody must have thrown a plastic bottle or so on our ground and we didn´t see that before your arrival. I apologize for that.
Your next complain referred to the way we receive our guests. Actually we don´t do the classical check in procedure, but accompany our guests straight to their rooms to have their welcome drink on their terracce while watching the sea instead of standing in front of the reception desk. Our welcome drinks are always fresh fruit juices, never from a can or made out of  powder. 
Regarding the breakfast I need to comment that we can arrange Hoppers only when ordering the day before, what you did. The reason is, that we do not produce them ourself and they can not be bought in a shop, but have to be produced fresh. Rottis are not offered by us (and they are not in our menue), as it´s a street food and definetely can be produced better in the respective snackbars. But it doesn´t mean that you had to order the same food, as we have a wide selection of breakfast items. Even if you both had Srilankan breakfast, I don´t understand the problem occuring regarding you being vegetarian. As you know the srilankan breakfast consists of different curries and it wouldn´t have been a problem to serve you a vegetarian curry while your husband enjoys his favorite kind of meat. 
In general I have the impression that you enjoyed your stay with us and I hope we can welcome you again at another occasion in the future. And if you pre-advise us about your visit, I will personally make sure, that you will have rottis at your breakfast table.
placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed here as part of a few days away for our anniversary in February and although the hotel (rooms, restaurant, staff, and location) are very nice, it is ridiculously overpriced for what it is and there are far better places to stay in Sri Lanka, (and Hikkaduwa) for a lot less.  Basically I would have loved the hotel if we had paid about 12,000 rupees bed and breakfast, but it was nearly double that and the rooms, food and service do not live up to the expectations that that price puts on them.  

To start with the (small) car park at the entrance to the hotel has some litter in it, then when we rang the bell and walked in it was as if they were not expecting us at all and there was no particular welcome or checking-in experience.  A welcome drink was however brought up to our balcony though, which we left for about 10 minutes whilst we unpacked and when we came back found that it had separated into half sugar syrup and half juice.  Breakfast was nice, we went for the Sri Lankan breakfast option, however the evening before (when we pre-ordered) one of us asked for rotti and the other for hoppers, and we were told we both had to have the same.  This would not be a big deal in a guest house at all, however when paying over one hundred pounds (including taxes) for bed and breakfast, I expect to be able to have what I want from the menu and not be confined to what my husband wants! - especially as he is a meat-eater and I am a vegetarian.  Finally, the pool is in a very unfortunate location, surrounded by high walls and near the kitchen so staff walking past constantly.  As a result is seems that it is rarely used.  

Anyway, these are not huge gripes, and I would not complain at all about these sorts of issues in a guest house.  However this is not marketed or priced as a guest house, so I expect a lot more. And moreover, in Sri Lanka, for that price, it is possible to find a lot more.
title: Terribly Overpriced

ownerResponse/text:
Dear guest,

thank you very much for taking the effort to write a comment about your stay at our Suite Lanka.

I am sorry to hear, that you obviously didn´t enjoy your stay with us. 
Regarding the rates you have mentioned, I am absolutely surprised. As you obviously stayed at the same category as your friend did, it was most probably a Superior room. The rate last year was indeed around USD 77 (plus tax & service charges).  At the moment we are charging for that room EUR 86 (inclusive of tax & service charge and breakfast for two). In Peak Season (christmas and new year) we are charging EUR 108,-. This is the absolute maximum we have always charged for that room. This can be verified by having a look in our pricelist (please refer to  www.suitelanka.com.). 
There are higher room categories however, for example the Two-Bedroom Suite at a size of 112 sqm, which we charge EUR 196 at the moment, inclusive of tax, service charge and breakfast. 
But I assume that you didn´t compare the rate of the entrance category with the rate of the biggest available suite.

However I am happy to inform you, that we have just recently completed a huge renovation of many parts of the hotel. Among them are the Superior and Deluxe rooms and their bathrooms, the restaurant, bar and poolside as well as all public areas, such as pathways, public bathrooms etc.  You may get a very good impression by having a look at our new virtual tour, which you can find on our website.
    
I hope, you will give us the chance again to prove to you that your next stay with us will be worth every single cent you are paying. If you are considering coming, please let me know in advance and I will personally make sure that you will have a great time.

Roland Galka
Owner
placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don't bother with the superior rooms - there is nothing superior about them other than the price.
text:
I think it's important to note the price paid at this property when reviewing it. We stayed here based on a friend's recommendation who loved it.  We were extremely disappointed with the property overall. Upon return we discovered that they had paid $77 per night whereas we paid in excess of $220 per night.

At $77 this property is just about acceptable.  It is really not worth anything more than that.

The pool at this property is completely useless - located behind the hotel between the hotel block and the kitchens with no view whatsoever and stagnant air.  Who needs a pool when the ocean is that beautiful? Yes, I agree - however you are paying a premium for a property with a pool.

The rooms do not have TV, phones, or any of the amenities one would expect for such a high price. The rooms are very spacious - but necessarily so - they are not nice at all and you really wouldn't want to spend any time in them with their dated furniture and dark interiors.

The location is about a 10+ minute walk down the beach to any of the popular bars and restaurants. This does not offer you much more privacy than the rest of the beach - we would have preferred to be closer to the restaurants.  There are no loud nightclubs and such on this strip where staying away would be a benefit.

The only explanation to the mixed reviews one finds on here is the price paid. If we had paid $77 we might have found this place just acceptable (not more). However at $200+ I would look elsewhere.

We spent 2 nights in Aditiya at more than double the rate (>$400 per night) and felt that was worth every penny - I have reviewed that property too.
title: HIGHLY OVERRATED! (read why)

ownerResponse/text:
Dear guests,

I am so sorry to realize that you are obviously still very frustrated about your brief stay, that you have to write such a comment one year (!!!) after your stay. 
I perfectly recall the situation that your travel agent called me a couple of times after your arrival, informing that you weren´t happy at all. 
As in general june is the month when the monsoon reaches its peak, it´s indeed more humid than during the rest of the year.
Unfortunately this evening one airconditioning system broke down. The manager arranged some technical help and the next morning the system had been repaired. 
Again I am terribly sorry for that. However having the privilege of being at this stunning location, we are facing major problems with all technical equipment, caused by the seabreeze, specially during monsoon season. We are trying our outmost to prevent impact to our guests well being and I am sorry, if we have failed in your case.

As during your brief stay I have always talked to your travel agent by phone and  never to you. 
I am therefore surprised that you call me a rude man without even knowing me.
As well I like to clarify that the confirmation for the refund to you has been made already while talking to your travel agent. I will recheck with them who is the "greedy little man" you are mentioning in your comment.
 
Finally I would like to inform you that we have closed down the hotel in may and june 2012 for a huge renovation. Please see the result at www.suitelanka.com/tour
If you wish to make your own personal experience, please let me know when you are intending to visit again and I will make sure that you will have a great stay.

Roland Galka
Owner
placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text: Terrible place. Visit as 2 couples in 2011. Its filthy. Its small. Its creepy, dark and dingy.The rooms are big, but furnishings from the 60's. The bathrooms need an overhaul. The shower had a trickle, and no hot water. The towels were the crappiest towels we had ever used, the water didn't try! It was ridiculous. Its locked up at night and there's one inept old man guard who can't speak english. There's no phone in the rooms. Only a bell, which we rung 10 times before the guard came. Our A/C leaked and flooded the room..it was hot and humid, plus there was a river in the room. We called our travel agency and said we wanted out of there. The owner, who was an extremely rude man sitting in Europe refused to believe us and refund our money. At that point we didn't care, we just wanted to get out. There were only two people present the next morning, they apologized but laughed at our awful sleepless night - we paid for the one night and got out of there asap. Our travel agency negotiated with them and got the money refunded but not before the greedy little man took some for himself. Spend some of it on your hotel and maybe people wouldn't have such an awful time. I can't believe the reviews on this hotel it should be listed as the worst hotel in the world. @ $80 a night to be paid in advance, its total crap. Don't do it.
title: Worst place in Sri Lanka!

placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
I stayed here with my partner in September 2011. We were really excited to be staying there as we thought it was going to be de luxe (considering the price!).

We had a room on ground level facing onto the beach. It was incredibly beautiful. Unfortunately, the room was not worth what they were charging for it. Everything was a bit run-down. The door locks had been eroded so much by the salty air that I got locked into the bathroom and management had to break open the door with a crowbar. The door was left broken for the remaining 3 days of our stay! The lights didn't work properly and in the evenings we found ourselves stumbling around in the darkness of our room rather frequently (and it wasn't due to power outages, just faulty electrics).

The staff were alright but mentioned a couple of times to 'give them a good review' which really irritated me because a) the hotel wasn't really up to scratch (especially after being stuck in the bathroom for ages) and b) it's up to me what type of review I decide to leave and it depends completely on my experience.

The best part about the hotel was the restaurant. The food was pretty delicious and definitely something I remember most fondly about the hotel. 

I will also say that while the beach is pretty nice, I personally found the beach in Unawatuna much better for amenities and the sea was much calmer for swimming. Also, I stayed in a nicer hotel for far cheaper!
title: Not worth the money

placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
roomTip: I would not pay more than $80 including tax for this hotel as it is.
text:
I am usually only inclined to write reviews if a hotel either impresses me greatly, or fails on the other end of that spectrum.  Neither am I the kind of person who finds it necessary to write a negative review because I found an ant on my pillow.  However as a trustworthy individual who has stayed at many hotels over the years, and several in Sri Lanka as of the time of this review, I can tell you... or rather warn you, this hotels is absolutely and completely overpriced!

This, I would assume, is the consequence of an owner who has delusions of grandeur, but deluded he is.  Even if you manage to find a good on-line rate ($157), it is still rather expensive for Sri-Lanka, but once you add the tax and service charge, it comes to around $200 a night.  Now, let me tell you, that for less that this, you can sit in the lap of luxury... right in it's lap.

Now, the hotel isn't terrible...  It was fairly clean, and yes, the balcony are big, and yes, the location is ok.  But these factors do not make a great hotel.  

It has a family run feeling, and the people are nice and they do their work well enough.  But the whole hotel wreaks of management desperate to make money and cut corners at every opportunity.  Old towels, no toiletries of in room refreshments such as coffee etc.  A milky white pool, a breakfast that can be described as such. Coffee. 1 Ring of pineapple, a slice of papaya, a juice, and 2 eggs prepared any of 3 ways.  Not to mention wild dogs who seemed to like the company of the hotel guests during breakfast.

We are also constantly reminded to keep the doors locked at all times, especially at night, something to give any traveller piece of mind.

All fine, but like I say, for $200 a night in Sri Lanka, this is a crazy joke and is clearly the result of a greedy management. 

May I recommend this... buy nice new towels, new fridges, some nice toiletries, a new filtration system for your pool, fix the doors, get some better locks on the doors, give better value drinks and food, clean the windows more !!! change the bar and entrance areas to be more inviting. Buy new uniforms. put a small fence to keep the dogs out... and then lower your price slightly, instead of investing all you money in to web site design that does not reflect the ambiance of the hotel at all.

As it stands, I will tell everybody who read this review, that for $200 do not consider this to be a wise choice for your money in any way.  Currently it is a bare bones, slightly tired base, with a nice looking frontage, that is pretending to be something it's not, with some fairly nice staff.
title: I would question the other recent reviews for this hotel.

placeInfo/address: 868 Galle Rd Thiranagama, Hikkaduwa 80240 Sri Lanka
text:
what a shame as this place could of been great but the problem was the sri lankan manager who was an idiot,thief and was only interested in cash for his pocket,i discovered that he had no respect for HIGIENE,Made the staff put the same used beach towels as the ones used the day before by other guests on the beach beds,so your thinking clean towel but its got other peoples sweat and whatever o them(DISGUSTING!!)Would only change the bed sheets every three to four days "as its expensive to do laundry".
Security man would come when he wanted,some nights no security even though they tell you its not safe to leave anything out or leave your windows open.....And many guests have had things stolen from there rooms.(cost of security man per night was 200rps £1.20p or $1.50 !!!!!)
Wanted paying in cash as he didn't want to put the money through the books as his German boss was in germany and would not know about the £600 given to him for my stay.(11 months wages for one of his staff) 
I feel sorry for the owner as he's being ripped off every day by this guy.
The prices for the rooms are way to high,you can walk down the beach and find 20 more places to stay for less and have all the services.
Charged you for complementary water after the 2days,as the bottles of complementary had ran out so you have to buy the water from him(crazy crazy)
Decided to add to the Mini bar bill 11 bottles of coke and i don't drink coke....
THIEFS!!!!
The only positive thing i can say about the place is the garden are nice and the chef is a great guy and friendly,funny and can cook well.....
Avoid this place if you can as at the beginning it all looks and feels good but a couple of days in you will start to notice all the bad things.
title: idiots

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Pooja

I am sorry the property did not meet your expectations but I do hope your refund at least went some way to curbing your disappointment. It is unusual for us to have this type of commentary and some of these comments are new and surprising to us. We will look into them and see what we can improve.
In the meantime, I wish you well and trust the rest of your trip was successful.

Best regards

Charles

placeInfo/address: Wijerama Road Brahakmana Watte, Balapitiya 80550 Sri Lanka
text: Location is excellent   Calamansi cove is situated on the beach. The pool is quite good.  If you are looking for luxury forget it.  The room are very basic   This very typical of my experience of Jetwing in Sri Lanka.   They have a lot to learn about what Westerners expect in service and the general standard of accomodation.The service is appalling. I ordered lunch and they served the table and had forgotten my main course. NO apology !!!
title: Forget it !!!

placeInfo/address: Wijerama Road Brahakmana Watte, Balapitiya 80550 Sri Lanka
text:
I visited this relatively new hotel during a recent visit to Sri Lanka and was rather surprised at the rates charged considering the poor choice and quantity of food provided. 

The rooms are stunning and the finishing touches are all to a very high standard so no complains there at all. It's also quite remote and private which is also something that appealed to me very much. 

What I found very disappointing was the food choice and quantity provided. For dinner I had a choice between a fish dish or a pork dish and dessert was either a trifle or fresh fruit! We ordered one of each and all I got was one meagre thin half slice of fish with a teaspoon sized dollop of mash. Mum got one small pork chop. I ordered the fresh fruit and all I got was half a banana, one triangle of watermelon and 2 half slices of pineapple! A joke considering the rate per night is nearly USD 300!! 

I ordered a carbonara separately for my 3 year old and was extremely surprised to receive something that didn't remotely resemble or taste like carbonara. My daughter didn't touch it. Any chef knowing his onions knows how to make a carbonara. 

Breakfast was also sadly another disappointment where I got one slice of bacon, I small sausage and 2 poached eggs. They don't even bake their own bread freshly. It was just bog standard shop bought sliced bread. No variety in anything whatsoever. 

Overall I won't be in a hurry to visit again. I understand the concept of fine dining but that is not the time or place for it. When we spend money on exotic holidays, food plays a great part in the overall experience. I wouldn't recommend this hotel purely because the money spent is just not worth the experience. 

char
title: Lovely hotel/ Terrible Food
